She's been in this business for 10 years and sells palm oil at a Sunday marketplace. She describes her major problem to be the difficulty of transportation. 

Mariatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more gallons of palm oil alongside with gari (a food made from cassava) and beans. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and pay her children's school fees. In the future, she would like to expand her business to a palm oil store. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more gallons of palm oil alongside with gari (a food made form cassava) and beans.

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en:
Ms. Shameem is a 50-year-old vigorous lady and a mother of six children. She deals in making and supplying bags and sacks which are used to store cotton and crushed wheat. She has gained 12 years of experience in this field. She stitches bags for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. 

However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of 25,000 Pakistan rupees from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to purchase cloth material such as cotton and nylon with some spools of threads in large quantity to inflate her sales. She is in her sixth loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior.

loans.use: to purchase cloth material such as cotton and nylon with some spools of threads in large quantity.

loans.name: Gulam- Fiza

texts.en: Ms Gulam- Fiza is a 35-year-old married woman and a mother of seven children. Five years ago, she started a beauty parlor business at the corner of her house. She offers many facilities to her customers such as makeup, hair styling, and facials. By providing her best services, she has become very famous on her street and makes enough to meet the household expenditures. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Currently, she requested a loan of Rs.30,000 to buy skin care products, bleaching and whitening creams, and packs of hair rollers. In this way, she will be able to deal to more customers time after time. She expects a boost in her earnings and dreams to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy skin care products, bleaching and whitening creams, and packs of hair rollers.

loans.name: Nigora

texts.ru: Нигора 31 год, умная,жизнерадостная,общительная женщина,замужем, мать троих детей. Так как она без высшего образования немогла работать в госучреждениях и зарабатывать. И для того, чтобы включить свой вклад для содержания семьи с 2008 года начала заниматься бизнесом, то есть продажей детской одежды. Кроме этого Нигора дополнительно занимается откормом КРС на дому. По бизнесу Нигоре помогает муж. Муж Нигоры занимается перевозкой гравей и песка. В течении нескольких лет от дохода своего бизнеса Нигора с мужем смогли построить дом и улучшили себе уловия жизни. На полученный кредит Нигора хочет отремонтировать детскую комнату. Нигора надеется на Вашу поддержку и помощь.
texts.en: Nigora is 31 years old, smart, energetic and social woman. She is married and has three children. Nigora does not have a college degree so she cannot work in a government office. In order to contribute to her family's support she has started a children's clothing shop in 2008. Aside from retail Nigora also raises cattle at home. Nigora's husband supports her business ventures and also transports gravel and sand for a living. After accumulating profits from her business for a few years Nigora and her husband were able to build a new house and improve their living conditions. Now Nigora is requesting a loan to also improve the children's room in her new home. Nigora hopes for you support and help.

loans.use: to repair of the children room in her house

loans.name: Nozigul

texts.ru: Нозигул молодая замужняя женщина. Ей 21 год. Она проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Нозигул вместе с мужем занимается торговлей. Они продают различные ткани для платья в своем районе проживания. Этим бизнесом они занимаются уже в течение 5 лет. Нозигул сейчас хотела бы увеличить товарооборот. С этой целью она запрашивает кредит для закупа тканей. В будущем Нозигул планирует расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en: Nozigul is a young married woman. She is 21 years old. She lives in Tursun-Zoda. Nozigul works in retail together with her husband. They sell various fabrics for dresses in their region. They have been running this business for 5 years. Nozigul wants to expand her goods turnover rate and is requesting a loan to purchase new fabrics for the store. In the future Nozigul plans to continue developing her business.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy handbags and pocketbooks.

loans.name: Las Flores De Pologua Group

texts.es:
La señora Amelia de estado civil casada, tiene 32 años de edad, curso 3 años de educacion primaria, tiene 2 hijos y 1 de ellos esta estudiando, ella se dedica a la preparacion de refacciones para vender, inició este negocio trabajando en un comedor y hasta la fecha lleva 4 años de experiencia. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es fletero.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizará para ampliar su capital de trabajo, comprando insumos para preparar refacciones diversas, en el futuro próximo desea tener un capital grande y obtener mejores ganancias; las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio y a la prestación de servicios.
texts.en:
Amelia, 32, is married and has two children, one of whom attends school.  She finished three years of elementary school.

She makes a living preparing refreshments to sell.  She started this business working in a restaurant and currently has four years of experience.  She has the complete support of her husband, who's a freight driver.

She's organizing a group to be able to request a loan that she'll use to expand her working capital by buying ingredients to prepare a variety of refreshments.  She wants to have a lot of capital and get better profits in the near future.

The other members of the group make a living in retail and providing services.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for food

loans.name: Farrukh

texts.ru:
Фаррух житель города Душанбе. Ему 28 лет. Он холост. Фаррух по профессии юрист. На данный момент он работает милиционером. Фаррух живет вместе с отцом, матерью, братом и сестрой.  
Фаррух обратился в Хумо за кредитом для приобретения автомашины марки Мерседес. Он хочет работать таксистом в свободное от работы время, так как ему необходим дополнительный заработок. Он намерен предоставлять услугу, такси. У Фарруха имеется опыт, он хорошо водит машину.
texts.en: Farrukh lives in Dushanbe. He is 28 years old, single and has a degree in law. Currently Farrukh works as a policeman. He lives with his father, mother, brother and sister. Farrukh has turned to Humo for a loan to purchase a Mercedes brand vehicle. He wants to works as a taxi driver in his free time, as he needs additional income to support himself. He is planning to use the car to provide taxi servies. Farrukh has a lot of experience and is an excellent driver.

loans.use: to purchase a Mercedes vehicle for use as a taxi service during his spare time for additional profits.

loans.name: Mahmuda

texts.ru: Махмуда жительница города Турсунзаде, расположенный в центрально-западной части Таджикистана. Ей 33 года. Она замужем и является матерью двоих детей. Ее муж работает в пекарне и занимается выпеканием и продажей лепешек. Сама Махмуда занимается вышиванием у себя дома. Она шьет национальные платья и коврики для молитвы. Махмуда занимается этим ремеслом с 13 лет. Кредит запрашивает для закупа ниток и тканей для вышивания. Махмуда очень благодарна своим родителям за то, что они дали ей возможность обучиться этому делу. Так как за счет своего ремесла она помогает мужу поддерживать быт.
texts.en: Mahmuda lives in Tursun-Zoda, located in the cental-western region of Tajikistan. She is 33 years old, married and has two children. Her husband is a baker and makes Tajik flatbread. Mahmuda is a seamstress. She sews and embroiders traditional Tajik dresses and prayer rugs. She has been embroidering since she was 13 years old and is very experienced. Mahmuda is very grateful to her parents for giving her the opportunity to learn embroidery as she can now use her talent to help her husband support the family.

loans.use: to purchase embroidery floss and fabric

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: Ms. Shazia is a 22-year-old single lady; she has been in the beauty parlor business for the past three years. She offers many facilities to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials. By providing her best services, she has become very famous on her street. In order to meet the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying more variety of cosmetics products for the parlor. But because of having low cash in hand, she contacted Kashf Foundation to apply for her first loan. She needs a loan of Rs 30,000 to buy hair care products, skin products and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities. She is hopeful to cater to more customers time after time, which ultimately help her to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities.

loans.name: Amado

texts.es:
El Sr. Amado es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que lucha y quiere seguir creciendo, este es su segundo crédito en Kivz, ya que el crédito anterior lo ha utilizado para la compra de insumos para su pequeña despensa, lo cual le ayudo mucho. 
Amado esta muy agradecido por la oportunidad que recibió ya que por medio de eso pudo mejorar un poco mas su negocio y dar mayor variedad a sus clientes.
Solicita esta nueva ayuda para poder comprar frutas, verduras, productos a granel, lácteos y demás para poder surtir su negocio y de esa forma seguir creciendo y dar a sus clientes lo que necesitan.
texts.en:
Sr. Amado is a hardworking and enterprising individual who strives to keep growing. This is his second loan with Kiva. His previous loan was used to buy provisions for his small food pantry and it was a great help.

Amado is very grateful for the opportunity he received. As a result, he was able to make a slight improvement to his business and provide more variety to his customers. He is requesting a new loan so that he can buy fruits, vegetables, grains, dairy products, and other items to restock his business. This will allow him to continue growing and provide his customers with what they need.

loans.use: to buy fruits, vegetables, grains, dairy products, and other items.

loans.name: Abduhalim

texts.ru: Абдухалиму 31 год и проживает он в городе Турсунзаде. Он женат и имеет одного ребенка. Абдухалим единственный кормилец в семье. Он занимается сельским хозяйством. У него имеется участок земли, на котором он выращивает овощи, в основном картофель. Он занимается растениеводством уже 8 лет и за счет дохода, получаемого с этой деятельности он обеспечивает семью. Абдухалим обратился за кредитом для приобретения минеральных удобрений для урожая картофеля. В будущем он планирует расширить свое сельское хозяйство.
texts.en: Abduhalim is 31 years old and lives in Tursun-zoda. He is married and has one child. Abduhalim is the sole provider for his family. He is a farmer who has a plot of land where he grows vegetables, primarily potatoes. He has been farming for 8 years and has been able to use the profits to support his family. Abduhalim has turned to us for a loan which he will use to purchase fertilizer for his potato fields. In the future he is planning to expand his farming activities.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for his potato crop

loans.name: Abdujalil

texts.ru: Абдучалил житель города Турсунзаде. Ему 43 года. У него жена и трое детей. Абдучалил имеет среднее образование. Он зарабатывает на жизнь занимаясь сельским хозяйством. У него имеется участок орошаемой земли, на котором он выращивает картофель и рис. Абдучалил опытный дехканин. Он занимается растениеводством в течение 11 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения минеральных удобрений для урожая картофеля и риса. Абдучалил хочет получить богатый урожай и за счет прибыли с продажи урожая женить своего старшего сына.
texts.en: Abdujalil lives in Tursun-Zoda. He is 43 years old and has a wife and three children. Abdujalil has a high school degree and works as a farmer. He has a plot of irrigated land where he grows potatoes and rice. He is an experienced farmer and has been working for 11 years. He is taking out this loan to purchase fertilizer for his potato and rice crops. He hopes to be able to collect a big harvest and use the profits from the sale to pay for the wedding of his eldest son.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for his potato and rice fields

loans.name: Hayatan

texts.en: Ms Hayatan is a 38-year-old married woman; she has been running a business of animal sales and purchase for many years. She buys animals (goats) at low prices, brings them up, then her husband sells them out in the market at higher prices. She has gained five years of experience in this field.  Initially, she faced problems in running her business, but after getting loan from Kashf Foundation, she was able to establish her business. Currently, she requested a loan of Rs.30, 000 to purchase two more goats. She is in her 4th loan cycle and has a good repayment history. She hopes to get a boost in her earnings and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Marelvis

texts.es: Marelvis de 38 años es madre de tres hijos en las edades de 2, 6 y 20 años. Ella desde el año 2009 emprendió su propia aventura de negocios, después de haber realizado un curso de repostería, y panadería en el Servicio Nacional de Aprendizaje, donde aprendió las mejores técnicas de cocción de estos productos. Hoy preparar tortas, flanes, postres y ha agregado últimamente almuerzos, con lo cual genera ingresos que benefician a su familia que de ella depende. Sus compras las realiza de contado en tiendas y supermercados y sus ventas las realiza también de la misma forma; para poder  ampliar su mercado y organizar su negocio como restaurante,  requiere mas capital y esto es justamente la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará una estufa industrial, con la que mejorará su infraestructura y poco a poco estaría cumpliendo su sueño de prosperidad.  Así Marelvis y sus hijos saldrán adelante con el esfuerzo realizado por ella en su trabajo autónomo.
texts.en:
Marelvis, 38, is the mother of three children, ages 2, 6, and 20.  In 2009 she set up her own business venture after taking a course in pastry-making and baking at the Servicio Nacional de Aprendizaje, where she learned the best cooking techniques for these products.

Today she makes cakes, flan, and dessert, and recently she added lunch.  She earns an income that benefits her family, which is dependent on her.  She makes her purchases in cash in stores and supermarkets.  She also makes her sales the same way.

She needs more capital to be able to expand her market and organize her business as a restaurant.  This is exactly why she's applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With it she'll buy an industrial stove to improve her infrastructure and little by little achieve her dream of prosperity.  This way Marelvis and her children will get ahead with her effort in her autonomous job.

loans.use: to buy an industrial stove

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en: Ms. Kalsoom is a 23-year-old married woman and a mother of two. She had a difficult time after her husband's business failure. She decided to work with her husband to support her family for their better future. Eight years ago, she began stitching work in her house. She stitches clothes for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. So, she applied for a second loan of Rs. 30,000 with Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors and packs of lace and zippers to create a means of increasing revenue, so that she may be able to generate a healthier source of income.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors and packs of lace and zippers.

loans.name: Shakila

texts.en: Ms Shakila is a 57-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her son at the corner of her house. The man shown in the photo is Shakila’s son; he assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market and dealing with customers by sitting at the shop. Over time, they have become popular in their community for providing good quality products and make enough to meet the expenses of the family members. Currently, Shakila requested a loan of Rs. 35,000 to buy packs of pulses, biscuits and beverages to inflate her sales. She is in her 2nd loan cycle and has a good repayment history. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of pulses, biscuits and beverages to inflate her sales.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 29-year-old Mamie from Moriba town Bo. She is married with two children between the ages of  two and ten years. One child is going to school. 

Mamie runs a grocery business; she sells cigarettes, sweets, milk, and candles at home. She has been running this business for five years. She works at the business from morning to night, seven days per week. Mamie says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation.

Mamie has requested a loan in order to buy more general store items like cigarettes, sweets, milk, and candles for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her installment and increase her business. In the future, she plans to open a big shop. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more general store items like cigarettes, sweets, milk and candles for resale.

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en: Ms Perveen is a 53-year-old married woman who is doing a business of milk sales for the past 16 years. She has one buffalo in milk; she sells its milk to many of her neighbors. Her business is good enough to give her decent life. She has two children; one of them is school going. She is very motivated to provide her children a beautiful life with a good education, food and clothing. She has improved her business to meet day-to-day expenses of life. Currently, she needs to purchase another buffalo to increase the production milk. For this reason, she applied for a loan of Rs. 30,000 to Kashf Foundation. In this way, she will be able to cater to more customers in her vicinity, which will ultimately help her to generate more income.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en: Ms Tahira is a 42-year-old married woman. She has been running a business of animal sales and purchase for many years. She buys animals (baby goats & baby cows) at low prices and brings them up. Then her husband sells them in the market at higher prices. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Currently, she requested a loan of Rs. 25,000 to purchase two more goats. She is in her 2nd loan cycle and has a good repayment history. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving quality food, health and education to her children through all her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en: Ms Rabia is a 25-year-old married lady and has been running a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at reasonable prices and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. Rabia makes enough to provide for her family. To make her store fully stocked, she requested a loan for Rs. 45,000 that she will use to buy rice, sugar, and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way, she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is in her 4th loan cycle and has a good repayment history. Rabia wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and flour from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en: Ms. Nusrat is a 40-year-old married woman. She has been running a business of animal sales and purchase for many years. She buys animals (baby goats & baby cows) at low prices and brings them up. Then, her husband sells them in the market at higher prices. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Currently, she requested a loan of Rs. 30,000 to purchase two more goats. She is in her 8th loan cycle and has a good repayment history. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a quality education to her children through all her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Yelena

texts.ru:
Елена работает на одном из местных рынков Новой Каховки. Торгует детской верхней одеждой, в торговле занята уже 10 лет. Бутик имеет свой, но приходится арендовать землю у администрации рынка. 
Елене понадобились дополнительные средства в размере 5 000 гривен для того, чтобы съездить закупить летний ассортимент детской одежды.
texts.en:
Yelena works at one of the local markets in Novaya Kahovka.  She sells children's outdoor clothing.  She has been involved in retail for 10 years already.  She has her own store but she needs to rent the land from the market administration.

Yelena needs an additional 5,000 hryvnia in funds, in order to go and buy an assortment of children's summer clothes.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of children's summer clothes.

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en: Ms Perveen is a 34-year-old hard working married lady. She has been doing a business of milk sales for the past 20 years. She is successfully running her business with the support of her husband. The man shown in the photo is Perveen’s husband. She looks after the buffaloes and performs the task of collecting milk from them while her husband sells it to different places on daily basis. Over time, they have become popular for providing good quality milk in their local community and earn enough income to meet their children’s expenses. She has some savings and applied a second loan of Rs. 35,000 to purchase another buffalo to keep up with the demands of her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is very thankful to Kiva and Kashf for their support.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Elgun

texts.en: Elgun is 28 years old. Elgun is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Fuzuli city. Now he lives in Fuzuli region, which is close to the occupied border, with his mother. He is a single person. His mother stays at home, so he is the only one earning an income. He started his barber shop business two years ago. Now Elgun needs a 2,300 AZN loan to to expand and make repairs in the place. He wants to use the money from his expanded business to help to treatment of his mother, who is ill. He is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him.

loans.use: to expand and make repairs in the place.

loans.name: Jugbeh D.

texts.en: Jugbeh D. is 30 years old and lives in the West Point, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is single with a 14-year-old child who is going to school and lives at home. She is a high school graduate, and she describes herself as a serious business woman. She manages her business well to enable her to support her home. Over the past three years, she has been running a table in the local market without facing any serious problem where she bakes and sells cookies. She started this business with a little amount that she got from her mother. She sells six days every week spending eight hours with her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more sugar, butter, oil, flour, baking-powder, etc. for her business. She plans to buy a piece of land and build a house. She likes to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia by enabling small business people to increase their business volume.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, butter, oil, flour, baking-powder, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
This is 27-year-old Aminata from Moriba town Southern area in Freetown. She is married with two children between the ages of three and five years. She decided to start this business because she did not go to school and has no option other than to do business. 

Aminata runs a palm oil business; she sells palm oil at a place call Sunday market. She has been running this business for the past eight years. She walks four miles each way to reach Sunday market place. She says that the main challenges to her business are insufficient capital to run her business and difficulty of transportation to return home with her goods.

Aminata has requested a loan in order to purchase variety of local food stuff like palm oil, gari, and coconut oil. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and improve her status of living. In the future, she plans to expand her business more. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of local food stuff such as palm oil, gari, and coconut oil.

loans.name: Vahe

texts.en: Vahe lives in Stepanavan city in the region of Lori. He is a young businessman, 31 years old. He lives with his mother. His father is in the Russian Federation in abroad work. Vahe has a small business on a leased space. It is an outdoor café which is located at the city park. He has been in this business for two years. All the products that he needs for his café, he takes from providers. The waiter of café at the same time is the cook of café, and he helps Vahe very much. Vafe’s café is very famous around their small town and people like to come here and enjoy their leisure time. Vahe wants to make this place more comfortable and more popular, and he asks a loan in an amount of 550.000 Armenian drams to buy children’s entertainment and gaming accessories.

loans.use: to buy children’s entertainment and gaming accessories.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 37 years old and married to Francis who also contributes to the family income. She has been running her mobile money transfer business and a beauty salon for about four years with an income of about KES 22,000 per month. 

She is taking her second loan with KADET LTD and wants to use it to buy a hair drier and to increase her mobile money transfer float. She hopes to open a beauty parlor.

loans.use: to increase her mobile money transfer float and buy a hair drier

loans.name: Seyran

texts.en: Seyran lives in the village Syunik, which is in the region of Syunik. He has a higher education, but has never worked since he has been always engaged in agriculture. Seyran is 50 years old, married and has children. He has a piece of land where he plants and cultivates different vegetables and fruits with great pleasure. All the agricultural products that Seyran has from his land, he sells to resellers in the towns of Kapan and Kajaran. Seyran wants to purchase fuel to organize the work around his farm and to buy seeds of vegetables. So, he hopes that with the help of Kiva lenders and Nor Horizon, his plans will be realized.

loans.use: to purchase fuel to organize the work around his farm.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 43 years old and lives in the West Point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is a widow with two children who live on their own. Florence did not go to school, but she is business-minded. For the past six years, she has been selling peppers, bitter balls, okra, etc. in the local market without facing any serious problems for now. She started this business by selling for her mother. She sells six days a week for 10 hours each day. In so doing, she is requesting a loan to purchase more peppers, bitter balls, okra, etc. to increase her sales. Her plan is to build a house. She likes to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more peppers, bitter balls, okra, etc. to increase her sales.

loans.name: Kannah

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Kannah from Moriba town Bo, Southern area in Sierra Leone. She is a married mother and blessed with three children. She started this business because she wants to stop sitting at home as a house wife and contribute in supporting the children. 

Kannah runs a palm oil business at Moriba town market. She sells palm oil and gari. She has been running this business for 15 years. She works in the business for nine hours per day, seven days per week. She says that her major hardship is cost of transportation, which is very expensive from her operation area to her house, and competition in the market. 

Kannah has requested a loan in order to buy more palm oil and gari for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her family's standard of living. In the future, she plans to open a big local food store. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil and gari for resale.

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.ru:
Надежда – из Новой Каховки. На местном рынке она работает в своем бутике, пока все же арендуя землю у администрации рынка. Надежда торгует колготками, носками, гольфами в большом ассортименте, а летом добавляет к своему ассортименту еще купальники и парео. 
Надежда планирует ехать за товаром и приобрести купальники, парео, носки и гольфы по оптовой цене на сумму 15 000 гривен под реализацию в своей торговой точке.
texts.en:
Nadezhda is from Novaya Kahovka.  She works in her own shop at the local market, but she still rents the land from the market administration.  She sells stockings, socks and knee-highs in large quantities, and in the summer she adds swimsuits and sarongs to her inventory.

Nadezdha is planning to go and purchase merchandise such as swimsuits, sarongs, socks and knee-highs at a wholesale price of 15,000 hryvnia.  She will resell these goods at her retail outlet.

loans.use: to buy swimsuits, sarongs, socks and knee-highs at a wholesale price of 15,000 hryvnia, and to resell these items in her shop.

loans.name: Anges

texts.en: Anges is 42 years old and lives in the West Point area, which is the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is married, and her husband is a businessman. They both have four children aged between 18 and 22; only one is in school and lives at home. She describes herself as a hardworking person; for the past 10 years she has been running a table where she sells rice, vita, oil etc. in the local market. She likes her business because of the ways the customers buy from her. She started this business with money given to her by her husband. She walks every day to buy her goods since her table is much closer to the local wholesales area. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, vita, oil, etc. for her business. She plans to buy a piece of land and build a house. She likes to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, vita, oil etc. for her business.

loans.name: Israil

texts.en:
Israil is 45 years old. He lives in Ochkhamuri village, Kobuleti district with his 42-year-old wife, four children and retired mother. Israil requested loan from the local financial institutions several times for his family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected every time because of his low income and his family’s poor living conditions.
 
Israil has a car. He drives it as a taxi to transport local people and earns small daily income, which is the main source of living for the family. Their additional income is Israil’s mother’s monthly pension. He is very hard working man and works long hours to earn good income, but it’s still not enough to feed his seven-member family.

He requested loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Israil has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re- start-up credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit, Israil will install gas equipment in his car. The gas is cheaper then fuel and with installing the gas system in the car he will decrease his expenses and increase the profit. Increased profit will help him provide all the needed living conditions for his family. Israil hopes for your support.

loans.use: To install gas equipment in his car.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Meet Hawa, she is in her late twenties and is from Moriba town Bo, in Sierra Leone. She is married with two children between the ages of four and 11 years. One of her children is currently attending school. In 2007, Hawa established her leather slipper business. She began her business because she did not go to school and her father was a shoemaker, so she was trained in business. She works in the business every day and moves around her community to introduce her goods. She says that the main challenges to her business are insufficient capital to expand her business and the sometimes slow purchasing power of customers.

Hawa requires a loan in order to purchase more leather slippers to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and renovate her house. In the future, Hawa plans to expand her business and build a permanent business structure. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more leather slippers to expand her business.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana is 43 years old and lives in the West Point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is married, and her husband is a businessman. They both have four children aged between 13 and 23; only two are in school and live at home. She was unable to go to school, but she is business-minded. For the past twelve years, she has been selling dry fish from a table in the local market. She likes her business because of the ways customers buy from her. She started this business with money given to her by husband. She walks every day to buy her goods since her table is much closer to the local wholesale area. She is requesting a loan to purchase more dry fish for her business. She plans to buy a piece of land and build a house. She likes to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more dry fish for her business.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 36 years old, married to Leah, and they have four children who are in school. He practices farming in Ndunyu Njeru.
He has applied for his third loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy fertilizer and seeds. He paid his previous loans on time. He hopes to pay school fees with the anticipated profit.
He hopes to educate his children and improve their living standards.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 55 years old, married, and a mother of four children. For the last eight years, she has earned a living by selling goods at her general store in Malindi. She earns a monthly profit of KES. 9,660.
Edna was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and is applying for her second loan of KES. 30,000. She will use it to buy additional stock for her shop such as cooking oil, washing powder, soft drinks, cooking flour and so on to sell to her customers. She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for her children as well as expand her business.
Her goal for the future is to continue growing her general store so that she can help give her family a good and stable life.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her general store.

loans.name: Fidelis

texts.en:
Fidelis is 34 years old and married with three children. He has been running his welding shop for about five years with an income of approximately KES 40,000 a month.
This is his third loan from KADET LTD, after successfully repaying the previous ones. He wants to use the loan to buy metal and other welding material for his welding shop. He hopes to be self-reliant and improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy metal and other welding material for his welding shop.

loans.name: Manzura

texts.ru: Манзуре 26 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Дети еще не совершеннолетние. Ее муж занимается выращиванием сельхоз культуры. Они живут в сельской местности и поэтому ее место жительство весьма благополучное для животноводства.  Она обучилась на курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых женщин и получила много позитива для себя. Она теперь уверена в себе, что может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной. Она планирует организовать бизнес скотоводством. Ее свекровь будет помогать ей введение бизнеса. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки скота. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Manzura is 26 years old. She is married and is raising two children. Her children are still underage. Her husband is in field crop cultivation. They live in a rural area and that's why her residence location is very prosperous for livestock. She has taken a course at the Achieve Success organized by the Association of Business Women and received a lot of positive emotions. Now she believes in herself that she is able to start a new business and become successful. She plans to start an animal husbandry business. Her mother-in-law will help her to run the business. She is asking for a loan in the amount of 5000 somoni to buy cattle. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle to start a new business.

loans.name: Musu

texts.en:
Meet 43-year-old Musu from Moriba town Bo, Southern area, Sierra Leone. She is widowed with three children between the ages of 10 and 20. Two of her children are currently attending school. In 2005, Musu established her palm oil business. She began her business because as a widow, she wants to generate income to support her family. She works at the business 8 hours per day, 6 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are competition in the palm oil business and sometimes vehicle breakdown on the way.

Musu requires a loan in order to purchase more local food like palm oil, beans and native rice. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and pay her installment. In the future, Musu plans to educate her children up to collage level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more local food like palm oil, beans and native rice.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris is 37 years old and lives in the West Point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County She is married, and her husband is a businessman. They have two children, ages 8 and 19; only one is in school and live at home. She describes herself as a hardworking person. For the past six years, she has been running a shop where she sells charcoal in the local market. She likes her business because of the way customers buy from her, and she started this business with money given to her by husband. By means of pickup, she gets her goods at her shop. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. She plans to build a house. She likes to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business,

loans.name: Micah

texts.en:
Micah is 25 years old, married to Joyce, and they have one child who is in school.
He practices dairy farming in Ndunyu Njeru. He has applied for his third loan from KADET LTD to enable him buy a cow. He paid his previous loans on time. He plans to buy another cow with the anticipated profit.
He hopes to buy much livestock in the near future.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en: Hadjah is married with eight children and three of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members, her grandchildren. She has a business selling local Gin and has been in this business for 5 years selling to all categories of people both on a retail and wholesale basis. Besides this business she also generates additional income through selling used clothes. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She is aspiring of start selling local Gin from her home and also to build rental rooms. Hadjah is requesting a loan to buy more jerry cans of local Gin. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expense includes school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more jerry cans of local Gin.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is 47 years old, married and a mother of three children. For the last three years, she has earned a living by selling clothes in Malindi. She earns a monthly profit of KES. 11,900. She is applying for her second loan of KES 30,000, to buy additional stock for her business such as dresses, blouses, trousers, and shirts to sell to her customers.
She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for her children as well as expand her business.
Her goal for the future is to continue growing her business so that she can help give her family a good and stable life.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of clothing.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is married with 4 children and they all go to school. She also takes care of an additional two grandchildren. She has a beauty salon and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 1.500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, braids, weaves and Vaseline. She works at the market six days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She aspires to own a fully stocked beauty salon and also to build rental rooms. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, weaves, braids and vaseline.

loans.name: Rahnamo

texts.ru: Рахнамо 30 лет. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. Более 6 лет она работает медсестрой в городской роддоме. Она очень хорошо знает свою профессию и очень бережно смотрит за женщинами, которые родили, а также за больными. Рахнамо полученную зарплату использует для обеспечения семьи. Ее мать портниха и таким образом зарабатывает деньги. Ее старшая сестра в Российской Федерации и там она работает. У Рахнамо есть еще одна сестра и брат. Ее сестра, которая живет вместе с ними, скоро планирует выйти замуж, однако у них нет сбережения, чтобы провести свадебное торжество ее сестры. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 7500 сомони для проведения свадебного торжества. Она ждет и надеется на вашу доброту.
texts.en: Rahnamo is 30 years old. She is married and lives with her parents. She has worked as a nurse in the town hospital for over six years. She knows her profession very well and looks after women who give birth and who are ill with care. Rahnamo uses the earned profit to support her family. Her mother is a seamstress and earns the money this way. Her older sister is working in the Russian Federation. Rahnamo also has one more sister and brother. Her sister who lives with them soon plans to get married, but they do not have any savings to hold the wedding ceremony for her sister. Rahnamo is asking for a loan in the amount of 7,500 somoni to hold the wedding celebration. She hopes and waits for your kindness.

loans.use: to hold a wedding celebration of her lovely sister.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Kadiatu is in her early 30's, and is married with children ages 6 and 12 years old. She runs a food stand business in Torkpoi town Bo, in Sierra Leone. Her children are currently going to school. Her husband is a village teacher but his income is not enough to support the home.

She's been in this business for eight years and sells different kinds of rice at Torkpoi town market. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to run her business.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more bags of rice. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve herself and her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business to a store level. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more bags of rice.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 38 years old, married and a father of three children. He operates a metal shop in Malindi and has been in this business for the last four years. He earns a monthly profit of KES 11,800.
Patrick was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and he is applying for his third loan of KES 30,000. He intends to use the loan to add tools and equipment needed for his business.
He will save the anticipated profit and help take care of his wife and children. In the future, Patrick hopes to grow his metal shop into a fully equipped car garage.

loans.use: to purchase additional tools needed for his business.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.ru:
Валентина – из Новой Каховки. Она арендует землю у администрации местного крупного рынка под свой бутик, который уже смогла выкупить. Валентина торгует женской трикотажной одеждой. Занимается этим бизнесом уже 17 лет. 
 Валентина в преддверии летнего сезона планирует пополнить ассортимент летней женской одежды, а именно приобрести трикотажные кофты, юбки, костюмы. Для этого она обратилась к КИВА за суммой 11 000 гривен. Валентина планирует и в будущем заниматься бизнесом, расширяя базу своих постоянных клиентов за счет торговли ходовым товаром.
texts.en:
Valentina is from Novaya Kahovka. She rents out a plot of land from the administration of large local market for her small shop which she was able to buy out. Valentina sells women's knitted clothing. She has been in this business for seventeen years.

Valentina is in the anticipation of the summer season and plans to fulfill the variety of the summer women's clothing such as knitted sweaters, skirts and suits. She has come to Kiva for a loan in the amount of 11,000 hryvnia. Valentina plans to continue do business in the future, to expand her regular client base by selling goods that are in demand.

loans.use: to buy knitted sweaters, skirts, suits.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet is widowed with 3 children and two of her children go to school. She also takes care of her nephew and niece. She has run a restaurant for the last 2 years. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas, beef, rice, Irish potatoes and smoked fish . She works seven days a week. She earns additional income through selling local Gin. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She aspires to own a fully stocked restaurant and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but no piped water. Her major business challenge includes school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of green bananas, beef, rice, Irish potatoes and smoked fish.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is Mariama, she is 29 years from Torkpoi town, Bo. She is single with 1 child who is 10 years old and goes to school. When she lost her father, she had no parent to take care of her so she decided to drop out of school and start up a business. She also has two additional dependents at home.
Mariama runs a Palm oil business in the town market. She has been running this business for 12 years. She works at the business 10 hours per day, 7 days per week. Mariama says that the main challenge to her business is lack of finances to expand it.
Mariama has requested a loan in order to purchase more palm oil for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and further her education. In the future, she plans to become a medical nurse. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Yerson Alexander

texts.es:
Yerson es un hombre de 20 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con sus padres y hermanos, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que ha tenido de trabajar para ayudar a sus padres, Yerson no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Mecánica que desea, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver películas y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos riquísimos Chicharrones para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Yerson trabaja como vendedor de materiales de construcción en una ferretería de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Yerson se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una cocina, ya que actualmente la cocina que utilizan en su hogar es de kerosene, presenta desperfectos y es peligroso su uso, de esta manera Yerson podrá brindar mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder estudiar una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Yerson, 20, is a single man who lives with his parents and siblings in the city of Ica, district of Parcona.  He is a very kind, hard-working, enthusiastic person who has a great desire to get ahead.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of resources and the need to work to help his parents, Yerson was unable to get a professional mechanic's degree as he would have liked.  In his free time he enjoys watching films and sometimes he cooks delicious pork cracklings to share with his family.

On his own initiative and with a lot of hard work and dedication, Yerson works selling construction materials at a hardware store in his city.  He works an average ten hours a day and believes work is going well for him because he is kind to people.

Yerson is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks their help he will be able to buy a kitchen stove.  The one they use at home now runs on kerosene, is in disrepair and dangerous to use.  So this means Yerson will be able to provide more safety and well-being for his family.  He will be able to continue working and striving to reach his goal of studying toward a professional career.

loans.use: To buy a kitchen stove.

loans.name: Vitalia

texts.es: La Sra. Vitalia tiene 40 años, casada con tres hijos que son de las edades de 12, 13 y 15 todas ellas en edad escolar, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su  tienda de barrio que se encuentran en la zona de Cotoca,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de mercadería para surtir su negocio como abarrotes, dulces y refrescos,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la mucha demanda que tiene y es ahí donde incrementa sus ventas, y necesita surtir su mercadería La Sra. Vitalia enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que existen varias tiendas en la zona, va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de mas mercadería para surtir su tienda y seguir creciendo más cada día, su deseo para  su negocio es de seguir vendiendo y tener una tienda surtida, así poder hacer crecer su negocio mejorar sus ingresos y por ende mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y de su familia.
texts.en:
Vitalia, 40, is married and has three childen ages 12, 13 and 15 who all attend school.  She sells essential groceries at the neighborhood store she runs in the Cotoca area.  This is her first loan through the institution and she will use it to buy merchandise to stock her store such as groceries, sweets and soft drinks.  The reason for the loan is that there is much demand and she will be able to increase sales, but only if she has more stock.

Vitalia has a lot of competition because there are several stores in the area.  She will use any profits she makes to buy more goods for the store so she can continue to grow on a daily basis.  Her goal is to have a well-stocked store so she can increase business, thereby improving her income and the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is a single mother of two children and one of her children goes to school. She also takes care of additional family members (sister). 

She has a business selling sweet bananas and has been in this business for ten years. She has applied for a loan of 700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy bunches of sweet bananas. She works at the market six days out of every week. She generates additional income through working as a sweeper and also selling charcoal.  

She works at the market six days out of every week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include transportation, thieves and seasonality. 

She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, school fees and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of sweet bananas.

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Fatu from Torkpoi town. She is married with three children between the ages of six and 15 years old. Her children are going to school. She began her business to be self-dependent.

Fatu runs a food stand business; she sells rice, cooking oil, Maggie onions and tomatoes paste. She has been running this business for ten years. She works at the business 11 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are insufficient capital to run her business and competition in the market. 

Fatu has requested a loan in order to buy more food items like rice, cooking oil, Maggie onions and tomatoes paste. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and roof her house. 

In the future, she plans to improve her business. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more food items like rice, cooking oil, Maggie onions and tomatoes paste.

loans.name: Jusu

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Jusu. He is married and has two children 14 and 18 years old. He has no additional dependents living with him.
In 1997, Jusu established his tailoring business. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 700,000 (Sierra Leone leones) every month from this business.

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 in order to buy more tailoring materials. Jusu has been unable to buy a piece of land where he intends to build a house. However he was able provide a better livelihood for his family from the proceeds of his last loan and was also able to pay school fees for his children. Jusu still hopes to achieve his dream of building a house and educating his children to the university level. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more tailoring materials.

loans.name: Emma Aracely

texts.es:
EMMA ARACELY
DOÑA EMMA ES ORIGINARIA DE SAN MARTIN JILOTEPEQUE ES UNA JOVEN DE 33 AÑOS DE EDAD Y TIENE MAS DE 8 AÑOS DE POSEER UNA VENTA DE ZAPATOS DE HULE Y PLASTICOS EN EL EXTERIOR DEL MERCADO MUNICIPAL DE SAN MARTIN, EN EL QUE OFRECE A SUS CLIENTES BOTAS PLASTICAS PARA ADULTO, ZAPATO PLASTICO PARA DAMA Y CABALLERO, SANDALIAS EN DIFERENTES ESTILOS,  COLORES Y NUMEROS ASI COMO TAMBIEN CALZADO PARA NIÑOS, DOÑA EMMA SOLICITA EL CREDITO PORQUE AHORA QUE SE ACERCA EL INVIERNO ES UNA EPOCA EN DONDE SU PRODUCTO TIENE MUCHA DEMANDA Y QUIERE SURTIR MAS , TENER VARIEDAD DE NUMEROS, ESTILOS Y COLORES DE CALZADO DE HULE O PLASTICO
texts.en:
Emma Aracely is a young woman from San Martin Jilotepeque.  She is 33 years old and has been selling plastic and rubber shoes outside the municipal market of San Martin for over eight years.  She sells plastic boots for adults, men's and women's plastic shoes, sandals in different styles, colors and sizes, and children's shoes.

Emma is requesting a loan because the winter season is approaching and it is the time of year when demand increases; so she needs more stock covering a wide variety of sizes, styles and colors.

loans.use: To buy plastic and rubber shoes to sell.

loans.name: Mery

texts.es: La Sra.  Mery tiene 32 años, tiene cuatro hijos de las edades de 10, 8, 6 y 4, ella se dedica a la venta material de ferretería como grifos para instalaciones de agua, tiene su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la populosa feria de la 16 de Julio en la ciudad de el Alto,   este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra.  Mery va a usar este préstamo para la compra material de ferretería por mayor  para surtir su negocio y  de esta manera brindar variedad de productos  a sus clientes,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, La Sra.  Mery va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando productos y así ir mejorando su negocio su deseo es tener una ferretería muy surtida. La Sra.  Mery es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada en la otorgación del credito.
texts.en:
Mery is 32 years old and has 4 children that are 10, 8, 6, and 4 years old.  She sells hardware materials such as water taps for sinks.  She has her own sales location that is located in a busy area called 16 de Julio, in the city of El Alto.  This is her first loan from this institution.  

Mery will use this loan to purchase hardware materials for her business so that she can provide a variety of products for her customers.  She is asking for this loan so that she can continue running her business.  She will use her earnings to continue buying more products, and by doing this she will grow her business because she wants to have a stable hardware business.  Mery is a hardworking person and is thankful for the opportunity to receive this loan.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale hardware materials.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 39-year-old Mariama from Torkpoi town. She is married with four children between the ages of five and 20 years old. Three of her children are attending school. She began her business to engage herself in doing something.

Mariama runs a food stand business; she sells onions, rice, tomatoes paste and pepper. She has been running this business for 15 years. She works at the business for 10 hours, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is the slow purchasing power of the customer.

Mariama has requested a loan in order to buy food commodities like onions, rice, tomatoes paste and pepper. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and educate her children. 

In the future, she plans to build a house. She thanks you for your support

loans.use: to buy food commodities like onions, rice, tomatoes paste and pepper

loans.name: Qibrije

texts.en:
Qibrije is an Egyptian Albanian seamstress in her mid fifties with two grown up children. She was widowed long ago. 

She has been a VFA client for a long time and “has good standards”, according to her loan officer. “I remember her starting the tailoring activity about three years back; she was passionate about serving her own Egyptian community,” said her loan officer.

Qibrije lives in the southeastern part of the country where some members of this community have literally thrived during the past twenty years of democracy; yet, others haven’t been able to secure daily food, unfortunately. 

Qibrije needs lender's financial help to buy some raw fabric material.

loans.use: To buy raw fabric material

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Mamie from Torkpoi town Bo, in the Southern Province in Sierra Leone. She is married with 3 children who are aged between 4-9 years. Mamie's children are currently attending school. Her husband is out of a job, so she supports the household all by herself.

Mamie runs a food stand business; she sells dry fish, onions, beans and pepper within a busy market area. She has been running this business for 15 years. Mamie works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to operate her business.

Mamie has requested a loan in order to purchase food items such as dry fish, onions, beans and pepper. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and educate her children. In the future, she plans to open a big food store. Mamie appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase food items such as dry fish, onions, beans and pepper.

loans.name: Rafiq

texts.en:
Rafiq is a 49-year-old married man. For the past eight years, Rafiq has had a grocery store selling different types of groceries. It has been a profitable project and the only source of income to him, but he also needs more support to cover the costs.
Rafiq is requesting a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing needed stocks of basic groceries and sweets that customers often request and buy, such as rice, sugar and milk. This will increase sales and increase Rafiq's income.
Rafiq is photographed in his grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase needed stocks of basic groceries and sweets to sell

loans.name: Ada

texts.en:
This is 48-year-old Ada. She is a widow and has one child aged 18. In 1993, Ada established her charcoal business. She began her business after her husband died. Her business is located in the outskirts of town and her main customers are women. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she earns about Le 950,000 every month from this business.

Ada would like a loan in the amount of Le3,000,000. She requires it in order to buy more bags of charcoal to re-sell. In the future, Ada plans to educate her son up to university level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal to re-sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jesus Balvino

texts.es:
Jesus es un hombre de 44 años, es vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago, tiene dos hijos, quienes son su principal razón en la vida, lamentablemente por diversas circunstancias se separó de su esposa, pero Jesus dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a sus hijos pues el siempre ha sido padre y madre para ellos, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas, ya que desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar para ayudar a sus padres, en sus ratos libres le gusta distraerse viendo televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos riquísimos Chicharrones para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Jesus trabaja como obrero de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, Jesus se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Jesus se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea pintar, tarrajear y ponerle piso a gran parte de su hogar, de esta manera Jesus podrá brindar mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver a sus hijos convertidos en buenos profesionales y en hombres de bien.
texts.en:
Jesus, 44, lives in the city of Ica, district of Santiago, and has two children who are his motivation for living.  Unfortunately, due to several circumstances, he is divorced from his wife; but Jesus does everything he can to provide for his children since he has always been aboth mother and father to them.  He is a very kind, hard-working, enthusiastic person who was unable to study Business Administration because he had to start work young to help his parents.  In his free time he enjoys watching television and sometimes makes delicious pork cracklings to share with his family.

On his own initiative and with much hard work and dedication, Jesus works as a field hand on a farm in his city.  He works every day for an average ten hours a day.  He is very happy with his work and believes it is going well for him because of his kindness to others.

Jesus is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to them he will be able to renovate his home.  He wants to cover and paint the walls and put down floor covering throughout most of the house.  This will allow Jesus to give his family more safety and well-being.  He will continue working hard toward his goal of seeing his children become professionals and good citizens.

loans.use: To renovate his house.

loans.name: Ahsiatu

texts.en:
Ahsiatu is 38 years old and married with 4 children, aged between 10 and 20 years. She runs a bread business in Moriba town, in the Southern area of Sierra Leone. Two of Ahsiatu's children are currently attending school, and the other two are dependents at home. 

Ahsiatu has been in this business for 15 years, and sells bread within a busy market area. She says that her business is doing well. She started doing her business to get income to support her children.

Ahsiatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase flour, sugar and other ingredients for her bread business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her children to develop. In the future, she would like to see her business grow and expand to a shop level. Ahsiatu is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar and other ingredients for her bread business

loans.name: Tina

texts.en:
Tina is a Ghanaian artisan who specializes in handcrafted jewelry with traditional beads. She would like to invest in the purchase of larger quantities of stone, silver, wood and bone beads. Since these beads come from Cameroon, Abidjan, and Mali, she can get a better price by purchasing larger amounts.

Tina has been selling through NOVICA since 2001. This is her story:

"I am a descendant of the Ga Mashie royal family, and when I was just three weeks old my father died. I wanted to be a teacher, but to cope with difficult financial times I taught reading classes while I trained in auto spraying. I also worked at a textiles company during the week and at the weekends I made beaded jewelry for personal customers and to sell at street markets. I've always been interested in working with underprivileged children, as I too suffered many hardships as a child. I started a program called 'Children In Need' in 1996, and I started teaching them our traditional bead making crafts. My designs are influenced by Ghana's varied cultural and artistic traditions, of which I've become an expert. I feel blessed with my talent, and I feel it is my responsibility to teach my craft to others."

"Thank you and may God bless you. The Bible says that 'whatever you do for your neighbor it shall be seen in heaven,' so I believe He is aware of your participation in this microcredit."

Use the link below to view Tina's African beaded jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/2705

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of larger quantities of stone, silver, wood and bone beads

loans.name: Wahyu

texts.en:
Wahyu is a Javanese artisan who specializes in beaded batik bags. She plans to stock up on fabric and other materials to increase production.

Wahyu has been selling through NOVICA since 2012. This is her story:

"I work in Java's legendary batik art. I'm always keen to learn new things and new techniques. My family taught me that I must work hard to succeed in life. Now I am married and we have a lovely daughter. In my small batik workshop, I specialize in handbags, cushion covers and table runners, and add details with beads."

"Thank you for your support by funding this micro-credit. For a small artisan, this is really helpful to make my workshop grow. I really hope people like my beaded batik bags and want to buy them. By purchasing my designs, you help also to introduce Indonesian batik motif to the world. Thank you so much!"

Use the link below to view Wahyu's beaded batik handbags and totes on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/8545

loans.use: to stock up on fabric and other materials to increase production.

loans.name: Kadie

texts.en:
This is 43-year-old Kadie. She is married and has three children aged 17, 12 and nine. In 1983, Kadie established her palm oil and garri business. She began her business because she wants to help take care of her family. Her business is located in the outskirts and her main customers are women, men and children. Working seven days a week and 16 hours a day, she earns about Le800,000 every month from this business. 

Kadie would like a loan in the amount of Le3,000,000. She requires it in order to buy more garri and palm oil to re-sell. In the future, Kadie plans to build a house and give quality education to her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more garri and palm oil to re-sell.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina es una mujer casada de 47 años de edad que de su matrimonio tiene 6 hijos una familia numerosa por la cual agradece a DIOS. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria no completado ya que solo pudo cursar el primer grado de educación. Ella tiene mucha experiencia ya que se dedica a esta actividad desde hace muchos años y fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron dicha actividad. Hoy en día lo ejerce en compañía de su familia, el terreno que cultivan es propio ya que lo pudieron obtener por medio de una herencia que el papa de su esposo les dio para que trabajaran y pudieran percibir ingresos para poder mantener su familia y hogar. El terreno que ellos trabajan está ubicado a una distancia de 100 metros de su casa de habitación a la cual se trasladan a pie diariamente lo cual les permite dar el mantenimiento a sus cultivos.

Catalina está solicitando ayuda para compra de fertilizante, abono, bombas de fumigación para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café, mismo que si no se le da mantenimiento y cuidado a tiempo puede ser dañado por la roya enfermedad que afecta especial mente esta clase de cultivo. 
 
Ella sueña con educar a sus hijos para que tengan una mejor calidad de vida, mejores oportunidades de empleo y mejores oportunidades en la vida.
texts.en:
Catalina, 47, is married and has six children and feels blessed with the large family she has.  She has only a first grade education but much experience in her work since her parents were the ones who taught her the trade.  Catalina and her family cultivate the land they were given by her husband's father so they could make a living and support the family and household.  The land is 100 meters from their house so they walk there every day to care for the crops.

Catalina is requesting a loan to buy fertilizder and spray pumps for coffee crop maintenance.  If she does not provide care and maintenance the crop can be damaged by mildew.

Her goal is to educate her children so they can improve their employment opportunities and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and spray pumps for maintenance of her coffee crop.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: El Sr. Mario tiene 32 años, tiene un hijito de un añito,  el se dedica a la Agricultura sembrando variedad de vegetales como también papa, yuca y maíz en su parcela que se encuentra en la comunidad de Villa Florida,   este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  El Sr. Mario va a utilizar  este préstamo en la  compra de semillas para  la siembra de papa y lo que implica el preparado de la tierra, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para obtener recursos  para la siembra y poder subsistir, El Sr. Mario enfrenta retos en su negocio que son las inclemencias del clima que en muchas ocasiones arruinan los sembradíos,  y utilizara los beneficios Para mejorara la su calidad de vida El Sr. Mario es una persona  responsable y trabajadora se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Mario is 32 years old and has a son that is just one year old. He works in agriculture and grows a variety of vegetables such as potatoes, yucca, and corn.  His land is located in the Villa Florida area.  

This loan is his first from this institution and he will use it to purchase seeds for planting potatoes and other items that he will need to complete the planting.  He is asking for this loan so that he can get the resources he needs for the harvest so that he can survive.  

Mario faces difficult business challenges, such as inclement weather, which has destroyed his crops many times. He is working hard to improve his quality of life.  Mario is a very responsible and hard-working person who is thankful to the institution for providing him this support.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Fatmata is 26 years old and married with three children, aged between 4 and 10 years old. 

She runs a grocery business at her house in Moriba town BO, in Sierra Leone. She got married at a young age to an older man; she decided to start a business because she wanted to create income to support the home. 

She's been in this business for four years and sells biscuits, sweets and cigarettes at home. She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more grocery goods like biscuits, sweets and cigarettes. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and take very good care of her children. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business to a shop level. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods like biscuits, sweets and cigarettes.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 41-year-old Aminata from Moriba town in the Southern area, in Freetown. She is married with 3 children between the ages of 7 and 18 years. Her children are attending school. Aminata was a housewife; she decided to start a business because she wants to contribute in the home.

Aminata runs a palm oil business; she sells gallons of palm oil. She has been running this business for 9 years. She works at the business from one village to another to buy the palm oil, and there is a particular place where they meet to sell. She describes her major problems as transportation costs and sometimes vehicle breakdown on the way.  

Aminata has requested a loan in order to buy more gallons of palm oil. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children. In the future Aminata plans to establish her business more. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more gallons of palm oil.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
This is 26-year-old Hawa from Moriba town Bo, in the Southern area, in Sierra Leone. She is married and a mother, blessed with one child aged 4 years. Hawa began this business because she wants to generate a permanent source of income to support the home. 

Hawa runs a palm oil business; she sells gallons of palm oil. She has been running this business for 6 years. Hawa works at the business 12 hours per day and 6 days per week. Her business is the only income she has. She says that her business is doing well because since her husband is out of a job, she uses the profit to take care of the family.

Hawa has requested a loan in order to buy more gallons of palm oil. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and support the home. In the future, she plans to open a palm oil store. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more gallons of palm oil.

loans.name: Ha

texts.en:
Ha, 45 years old, is married and has two children. She and her husband have a clothing business. They have been running this business for eight years. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Ha intends to take a loan to buy a sewing machine for serving more customers. This purchase will enable her to meet her customers' demands. She hopes her business will run smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for serving more customers

loans.name: Diep

texts.en:
Diep, 41 years old, is married and has three children. She and her husband have been running a clothing business. They have been running this business for five years. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Diep intends to take a loan to buy fabric and materials for producing more clothes. This purchase will enable her to increase her sales and to meet her customers' demands. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fabric and materials for producing more clothes

loans.name: Argentina

texts.en:
Argentina and her husband Francisco are Guatemalan artisans who organized a foundation in memory of their daughter, where young people with disabilities could learn to create handicrafts. They would like to purchase materials such as paper, glue and beads to continue their work.

Argentina and Francisco have been selling through NOVICA since 2010. This is their story:

"Our daughter Nyla Eliza was born with hydrocephaly. She underwent several operations and as a result contracted meningitis, which left huge side effects and multiple disabilities. She passed away when she was 10 years old. In 1998 we founded Asociacion ADISA in her honor. What first began as a support group for parents and children with special needs has now become an association that provides education so that children can join mainstream schools. Youngsters adore making recycled paper crafts so they may eventually have a craft when they are too old to attend ADISA."

"Thanks to this micro-credit, we will be able to continue giving job training and work to disabled young people. Your generosity will help our project to continue growing and we are very grateful for your assistance. Thank you!"

Use the link below to view Argentina's recycled paper home decor on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/7331

loans.use: to purchase materials such as paper, glue, and beads to continue their work

loans.name: Noor

texts.en:
Noor is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Nidal appears in her Kiva profile photo, having the picture next to his rickshaw. 

Noor is a 32-year-old married young woman. She is a mother to two sons and two daughters. Her husband Nidal is employed and gets a small salary, which is not enough to cover all the family's needs. For the past year, her husband has been driving a rickshaw, which has been a profitable project. She is requesting a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the costs of purchasing a new rickshaw.
