This will help Noor's husband have his own rickshaw and to work extra hours and take more requests, which will improve the family's income positively.

loans.use: to complete the price of purchasing a new rickshaw.

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo, having the picture in front of his taxi.

Mona is a 47-year-old married woman and a mother to one son. For the past 18 months, Mona's husband has been driving a taxi, which has been a profitable project and the only source of income to the family. She is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her husband complete the price of purchasing a new taxi to drive. This will enable Mona's husband to have his own taxi and to work extra hours, which will enable her husband to take additional internal and external requests. This will improve the family's income positively.

loans.use: to complete the price of purchasing the taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase material for use in making sweaters for sale.

loans.name: Kula

texts.en:
Meet 44-year-old Kula from Moriba town, Bo, in the Southern area, in Sierra Leone. She is married to a driver and blessed with 3 children between the ages of 8 and 16 years. Two of her children are currently attending school. In 2004, Kula established her palm oil business. She began her business because she wanted to create an income to support the home. She works at the business every day, and she walks 4 miles away to her operation area. She says at present she faces a transportation problem in reaching her operation area.   

Kula requires a loan in order to buy more gallons of palm oil, and alongside this, beans and pepper. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to renovate her house and educate her children. In the future, Kula plans to build a big store in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more gallons of palm oil, beans, and pepper.

loans.name: Tenneh

texts.en:
Meet 27-year-old Tenneh from Moriba town, Bo, Sierra Leone. She is single, with 3 children between the ages of 5, 8 and 11. Her children are currently attending school. In 2006, Tenneh established her fish business. She began her business because she is alone taking care of her children. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 6 days per week. She describes her major problem as that if the purchasing power is slow, the fish becomes spoiled. 

Tenneh requires a loan in order to buy more carton fish for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, Tenneh plans to purchase larger quantities of fish. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more carton fish for resale.

loans.name: Lam

texts.en:
Lam, 44 years old, is married and has two sons. He and his wife run a clothing business. They have been running this business for eight years. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Lam intends to take a loan to buy a sewing machine for serving more customers. This purchase will enable him to meet his customers' demands. Lam hopes his business runs smoothly and will help him to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for serving more customers

loans.name: Abdelghani

texts.en:
Abdelghani is a 32-year-old single young man. He is employed to do data entry in a local hospital. He gets a small salary, which is not enough to cover all his needs. Abdelghani wants to improve his skills at work and is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing a new laptop. 

This will help him improve his skills in using the computer and to do his reports. This will ensure a better future for Abdelghani and improve his living conditions. 

Abdelghani is photographed at the hospital where he works.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop.

loans.name: Hasnaa

texts.en:
Hasnaa is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo, having the picture where they are raising sheep.

Hasnaa is a 50-year-old married woman and a mother to four sons and four daughters. For the past three years, she and her husband have been raising and selling sheep and sheep products, which has been a profitable project, but also needs more support to cover the family's needs.

She is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing more sheep. This will expand their project, increase sales and improve the family's income.

loans.use: to bring more sheep.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Kadiatu is 46 years old and married with 3 children, aged between 7 and 20 years. She runs a used bags business in Moriba town, Bo, in the Southern area, Sierra Leone.

Kadiatu has been in this business for 12 years and sells used bags within a busy market area. She says her business is doing well; she has no competition in the used bag business.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more used bags and expand her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her level of living and educate her children. In the future, she would like to see her business expand and grow to a higher level. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more used bags and expand her business

loans.name: Musu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 27-year-old Musu from Moriba town, Bo. She is married with 2 children between the ages of 3 and 9 years. Her children are attending school and there are also four additional dependents at home.

Musu runs a baby clothing business; she sells baby shoes and baby clothing. She has been running this business for 5 years. She works at the business 11 hours a day, 6 days per week. Musu says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to run it.

Musu has requested a loan in order to buy more baby clothing for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, she plans to own a shop. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more baby clothing for resale.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en: Hoa would like to take a further loan to buy more soft drinks to sell from her stall. Hoa's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers, and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her working capital and buy a wider variety of soft drinks.

loans.name: Ha

texts.en: Ha is requesting a new loan to buy sewing materials. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers, and increasing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more materials to increase her production of clothes

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
Thanh is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products.
She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy more food and beverages to restock her store

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Lan is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products.
She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of food and beverages to restock her store.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en: Hoa would like to take a further loan to buy food for selling and to pay school fees for her children. Hoa's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers, and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy food for selling and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Madame Awa vit au Sénégal. Elle est mariée et pratique le commerce de tissus. Elle a acquis une expérience  de 03 ans dans l’achat et la vente de tissus. Elle est sociétaire  de  l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC où elle sollicite un crédit d’un montant de 100.000 francs CFA. Elle envisage avec son financement d’acheter des tissus qu’elle va revendre à sa clientèle. Son objectif est de  développer son activité et accroitre ses bénéfices. Par conséquent, elle pourra avec ces derrières  améliorer les conditions alimentaires de sa famille et élever son taux d’épargne. Son projet futur est de développer davantage son activité commerciale et disposer d’un magasin pour exposer sa marchandise.
texts.en:
Mrs. Awa lives in Senegal. She's married and a fabrics merchant. She has three years of experience in buying and selling fabrics. She's a member of a  local branch of Kiva's partner, U-IMCEC, from which she's seeking a loan of XOF 100'000.

She intends to use this loan to buy fabrics that she will resell to her clientele. Her goal is to bolster her business and increase her profits. As a consequence, she'll be able to improve the nutritional conditions of her family and increase her savings.

Her future project is to further expand her business and have a shop to display her products.

loans.use: to buy fabrics to resell

loans.name: Ramona Edith

texts.es: Hace 4 años, cuando Ramona trabajaba como niñera, unas amigas suyas le sugirieron que le vendiera productos a créditos, que ellos estaban necesitando, ella aceptó y así fue como dió inicio a su negocio, en el cual hoy vende ropa, calzado, bolsos y accesorios femeninos. Desde el año 2009, cuando empezó no ha cesado de trabajar desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche, de lunes a domingos. Hoy su clientela ha superado sus expectativas y posibilidades de responder oportunamente a sus pedidos, porque tiene el capital representado en sus cuentas por cobrar. Esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará en mayor volumen que el acostumbrado, ropa femenina, jeans, camisetas, blusas y calzado además de bolsos elegantes y accesorios para damas. Su meta mas adelante es abrir al público un punto de ventas y adquirir sus propia casa, ahorrando para el futuro y respondiendo a su sueño de prosperidad..
texts.en:
Four years ago, when Ramona was working as a nanny, some of her friends suggested that she start selling products on credit, goods that her friends needed. She accepted, and that was how her business started. Today she sells clothes, footwear, bags and other items for women. She has not stopped working since 2009, when she began. Her day starts at 8 in the morning and continues until 7 at night, Monday to Sunday.

Her customer base has exceeded expectations, but also it has exceeded her capacity to meet orders. This is because her capital is on the books but she has not yet received payment. This is why she has approached Kiva for a loan. This is the first time she has requested finance, which is doing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. 

She will use the money to buy women’s clothes in bulk, more than she would normally buy. She will purchase items such as jeans, t-shirts, blouses and footwear, as well as elegant bags and other ladies’ accessories. Her goal for the future is to open a sales outlet open to the public and to acquire her own home, saving for the future and with the hope of realising her dream to have a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy women's clothes, such as jeans, t-shirts, blouses and footwear, as well as elegant bags and other ladies’ accessories, in bulk

loans.name: Ziad

texts.en:
Ziad is a 56-year-old married man and a father to two sons and three daughters. He is a UN school teacher who gets small salary which does not cover all his family's needs.
Ziad wants to live in better home conditions with his family, so he is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to cover the cost of painting his house and adding new necessary decorations. Taking this loan will offer Ziad and his family suitable home conditions so they can enjoy living in their house.
Ziad is photographed inside his house.

loans.use: to paint the house and purchase new decorations for it.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 20-year-old single young man. His father is employed and earns a small salary but it is not enough to cover the family's needs. Ahmad is a university student who wants to complete his studies, so he is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing a new laptop. This will help Ahmad to do his homework and reports and help him in his studies. This will ensure a better future for Ahmad and improve the family's living conditions. Ahmad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop to use for his university classes.

loans.name: Los Amigos Group

texts.es: La Sra. Luisa,  tiene 23 años y tiene tres hijos que son de las edades de 2, 4 y 6 años,  se dedica a la venta de variedad de refrescos y también algunas veces comida, tiene su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la zona de Cota Cota,  este préstamo es su primera  secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Luisa va a usar este préstamo para la compra variedad de insumos para la elaboración de sus refrescos como azúcar frutas naturales, esencias, etc.  y  de esta manera brindar variedad de productos a sus clientes,  su razón para solicitar es la falta de efectivo para realizar los insumos necesarios,  la Sra. Luisa va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir mejorando su negocio  y así mejorando sus ingresos, su deseo para su negocio es tener un restaurante y así brindar un  mejor servicio a su clientela. La Sra. Luisa es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse.
texts.en: Luisa, who is 23 and the mother of three children of 2, 4 and 6, sells various soft drinks, and occasionally food, from her stall in the Cota Cota district of La Paz.  This will be her first loan cycle with the institution and she plans to use it to buy various supplies for making soft drinks (sugar, natural fruit and fruit essences etc.), and to offer a variety of goods to her customers.  She is applying for the loan because she lacks cash to buy the supplies she needs.  Luisa intends to use the profits to continue to expand her business and, consequently, boost her income.  Her ambition, as far as her business is concerned, is to open a restaurant so that she can serve her customers better.  Luisa is a very hardworking person who is delighted to have been provided with this opportunity, because this business is her sole means of supporting herself.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make soft drinks

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en:
Ashraf who appears in the photo, is a 30-year-old married man and a father to one son and one daughter. Ashraf is employed but the low salary he earns is barely enough to cover his family's needs.
Ashraf is requesting a USD youth loan from FATEN to enable him cover the cost of purchasing necessary construction supplies such as iron, wood and cement. Taking this loan will enable Ashraf to complete the building of his house, which will offer Ashraf and his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies to complete the building of his house.

loans.name: Osama

texts.en:
Osama who appears in the picture, is a 43-year-old married man and a father to one son and two daughters. He is employed and gets small salary which is not enough to cover all the family's needs.
Osama is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing new bedroom furniture. This will offer Osama and his wife comfortable furniture and will improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase new bedroom furniture.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en: This is Isatu who is 27 years old. She is married and has two children who are 11 and 4 years old. She has one additional dependent living with her. In 2008, Isatu established her provisions, school uniform, slippers, and foodstuff business. She began her business because she wanted to raise funds to pay her school fees to further her education. Working seven days a week and six hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,200,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Isatu requires a loan in order to buy more provisions, uniform materials, and slippers for her business. Isatu used the proceeds from her last loan to help her husband complete the dwelling house for their family. Parts of the proceeds were used to pay fees for her children and provide a better quality of life for her family. Isatu plans to continue to support her husband to educate their children to the university level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more provisions, uniform materials, and slippers for her business.

loans.name: Eddy

texts.en:
Eddy who appears in the picture, is a 23-year-old married young man. Eddy is employed and gets a small salary which is barely enough to cover his family's needs.
Eddy is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing a new laptop. This will enhance his skills in using a computer and its applications and allow him to do his reports. This will ensure a better future for Eddy and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new laptop.

loans.name: Samia

texts.en:
Samia is a 23-year-old single young woman. Her mother sews clothes for her loyal customers, which is a profitable project, but not enough to cover all the family's needs.
Samia is studying at the university, specializing in accounting. Samia wants to complete her studies by paying her university fees, so she is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the fees. This will ensure a better future for Samia and improve the family's living conditions. Samia is photographed at the university where she studies.

loans.use: to pay for university fees.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Mary. She is married and has three children, who are 16, 7 and 5 years old respectively.
In 2007, Mary established her drinks business. She began her business because she wanted to assist her husband in taking care of the children. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 900,000 every month from this business.

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Mary now requires this loan in order to buy different types of drinks to meet the needs of her customers. Mary has not opened any new business outlets because she was not able to secure a place to do so. However the profit from her business allows her to feed her children, pay school fees for her children and provide medical care for her family. Mary still plans to open more business outlets and wishes to continue giving quality education to her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy different types of drinks to meet the needs of her customers.

loans.name: Francisco Manuel

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Francisco con su anterior credikiva, con el cual compró productos de reciclaje, servicios de autógena y soldaduras eléctricas, se benefició mucho con esta inversión porque compró justamente lo que le produce mayores ganancias. Sus negociaciones con proveedores han mejorado y está realizando trámites para obtener casa propia. Francisco está muy agradecido con sus financiadores de Kiva y pide que lo Sigan apoyándolo para seguir laborando y tener mejor calidad de vida. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva con el cual planea ampliar su negocio de reciclaje, comprando tanques plásticos de gran tamaño, porque la inversión debe hacerla diariamente y por eso requiere tener efectivo disponible para ensancharlo y poder generar más ingresos. Su inversión será exitosa porque este es un producto de mayor salida en el mercado y porque también ofrece un buen margen de rentabilidad.
texts.en: Francisco is grateful for the support provided by his first Kiva loan, which he used to buy recycling products and pay for welding and electrical soldering services.  He benefitted greatly from this investment because he was able to buy exactly those things which allow him to make higher profits.  His negotiating power with his suppliers has improved and he is taking steps to buy his own home.  Francisco is very grateful to Kiva lenders and asks that they continue to support him so that he can continue working and have a better quality of life.  He is currently applying for a new Kiva loan which he plans to use to buy the large plastic tanks he needs to expand his recycling business. As he has to make payments daily, he needs to have cash available to expand his business and be in a position to generate higher income.  His investment will be successful because this is a product which sells extremely well and because it also offers a good profit margin.

loans.use: to buy large plastic tanks

loans.name: Deen

texts.en:
This is 46-year-old Deen. He is married and has three children, ages 15, 6 and 3 years. He has one additional dependent in his younger brother, who helps him in the business. 

In 1996, Deen established his pharmaceutical drugs, toiletries and cosmetics business. He began his business because he was unable to continue school. He started up a small-scale business that he has developed over this period. Working seven days a week and 14 hours a day, he earns about 1,300,000 Sierra Leone leones (SLL) every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Deen requires a loan in order to buy pharmaceutical drugs, toiletries and cosmetics for his business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. Deen used proceeds from his last loan to improve his drug store, provide livelihood for his family and pay school fees for his children. Deen's main plan is to support his children in pursuing a university education. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy pharmaceutical drugs, toiletries and cosmetics for his business.

loans.name: Saron

texts.en:
Saron is a rural villager from the Ponhea Leur district of the Kandal province. Rice farming is a popular business in this neighborhood. Saron is 39 years old and married with four children. She has been farming rice on three hectares of farmland. Having been in this business for 22 years, she can earn about 30,000 KHR per day and manage to save about 15,000 KHR each day after daily expenses.

Saron has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the past loan. It helped her better support her family’s business and improve her livelihood. This cycle, she is applying for an education loan of US $160 to cover the entire tuition fee for her daughter to study the Korean language. Saron hopes to keep her daughter in school until graduation in order to get a good job so as to support and improve the family.

loans.use: To cover the entire tuition fee for her daughter to study the Korean language

loans.name: Lamin

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Lamin. He is married and has one child, aged 3 years. In 2004, Lamin established his phones and phone accessories business. He began his business because he wanted to support himself. His business is located in the outskirts of town and his main customers are people living in his community. 

Working 7 days a week and 15 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,200,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Lamin requires a loan in order to buy more phones for resale. In the future, Lamin plans to improve his business to enhance his ability to provide quality education for his child. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more mobile phones for resale

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria de 38 años de edad, habita con su cónyuge y su hija de 4 años de edad. Ella desde hace 4 años, se dedica a la actividad comercial, la que inició con el fin de apoyar los gastos de su hogar, generando ingresos de manera autónoma. Anteriormente Maria trabajó como empleada del servicio doméstico, y ahorró para comprar sus primeros artículos  para la venta,  una vez se retiró de este oficio. Hoy trabaja de lunes a domingos, desde el medio día, hasta la noche. Sus compras las realiza de contado y sus ventas a créditos que otorga a corto, plazo, entre moradores del barrio donde habita, familiares y referidos, que día a día se convierten en sus clientes fijos. Su meta mas adelante es tener un local propio y su mayor desafío es adquirir una casa propia, para cumplir su sueño de prosperidad. En la actualidad está aplicando aun credikiva, mediante el cual comprará perfumería y cosméticos para damas y caballeros, con el fin de darle una mayor variedad a su oferta e impactar la atención, el interés, el deseo y la acción de compra de estos artículos, entre su clientela, haciendo de su credikiva la mejor inversión del año.
texts.en: Maria is 38 years old. She lives with her partner and their daughter who is 4 years old. For four years, she has been dedicated to commercial activity which she began with the goal of supporting the home expenses, generating income in an independent way. Previously, Maria worked as a domestic worker and she saved to buy her first items to sell and then retired from that job. Today she works from Monday to Sunday from midday until nighttime. She makes her purchases with cash and makes her sales on credit that she grants on a short term basis to residents of the neighborhood where she lives, as well as family members and people referred to her, who day after day become regular customers. Her goal in the future is to have her own shop and her greatest challenge is to acquire her own house to accomplish her dream of prosperity. Currently she is applying for a CrediKiva through which she will buy perfume and cosmetics for men and women, with the goal of providing a greater variety to her range and impact the attention, interest, desire and action to buy these items among her customers, making her CrediKiva the best investment of the year.

loans.use: to buy perfume and cosmetics for women and men.

loans.name: Petrona Irene

texts.es:
Petrona, es una humilde comerciante, es dueña de una tortillería, vive en Managua, madre de 1 hijos de 3 años de edad. Comenzo su negocio por la necesidad de obtener ingresos para  su hogar ya que los de su esposo no eran suficiente, empezó con una libra de maíz y leña. Por las noches vende plátanos fritos con queso como otra forma de conseguir ingresos, es así como se gana la vida a diario.   
Ella está necesitando el crédito para comprar maíz, leña y cal. Materia prima que utiliza para producir sus tortillas. Ella quiere poco a poco ir mejorando el techo de su cocina donde realiza las tortillas, comprar una mesa y una cocina industrial.
texts.en:
Petrona is a humble businesswoman, owner of a tortilleria. She lives in Managua, is mother to one three-year-old child. She began her business due to the need to obtain income for her home since that of her husband was not enough. She began with a pound of maize and wood. At night, she sells fried plantains with cheese as another way to get income. It is in this way that she earns daily life.

She needs the loan to buy maize, wood and lime, main ingredients that she uses to produce her tortillas. She wants gradually to improve the roof of her kitchen where she makes the tortillas, to buy a table and an industrial kitchen.

loans.use: to buy maize, wood and lime.

loans.name: Zonia

texts.es: Zonia, de 54 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, con muchas ganas de progresar, está casada y tiene 3 hijos, vive en compañía de su esposo, su hijo y su nuera en su propia casa.La actividad que realiza Zonia es la venta de productos comestibles tales como arroz, azúcar, pan, leche, huevos, aceite, fideos,entre otros. Para eso cuenta con una tienda la cual esta instalada en su casa, desde ahí atiende diariamente ofreciendo sus productos a sus clientes que por lo general son sus propios vecinos. Realiza esta actividad sola y en ocasiones con el apoyo de una de sus hijas. También vende comida por las noches.Le  gusta su trabajo pues le permite estar en la comodidad de su hogar, así como los ingresos económicos que le genera para apoyar a su pareja con los gastos de su hogar.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 3800, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.El monto solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de más productos comestibles como pan, arroz, azúcar, huevos, leche y aceite.
texts.en: Zonia, 54 years old, is a hard working and earnest woman with a strong desire to progress. She is married and has three children. She lives in the company of her husband, her son and her daughter in their own house. The activity that Zonia performs is selling edible products like rice, sugar, bread, milk, eggs, oil, noodles, among others. For this, she has a store which is in her house. From there she attends daily offering her products to her customers which, in general, are her own neighbors. She performs this activity alone and on occasion with the support of one of her daughters. She also sells food at night. She likes her job since it allows her to be in the comfort of her home, as well as the economic income it generates to support her partner with the household expenses. At this time, she will request S 3800. She is very happy to know that she will have financial support since she will feel certain to advance with her business. On the other hand, she promises to make her payments in a punctual manner. The amount requested will be invested in the purchase of more edible products like bread, rice, sugar, eggs, milk and oil.

loans.use: to buy products like rice, bread, eggs, milk, among others.

loans.name: Nargis

texts.ru: Наргис замужняя женщина с тремя детьми. Ей 31 год. Она проживает в городе Турсунзаде. В данный момент ее муж находится за переделами страны на заработках. Вместе с ними живет еще ее свекровь, которая является пенсионером. Сама Наргис занимается торговлей вот уже 6 лет. У нее имеется торговая точка на центральном рынке города, где она продает женскую одежду. Наргис намерена увеличить товарооборот. Она запрашивает кредит для закупа ассортимента сезонной женской одежды на продажу. В будущем Наргис планирует расширить свой торговый бизнес.
texts.en: Nargis is 31, married and the mother of four. She lives in Tursunzade. Right now her husband is working abroad. Her mother-in-law, who is retired, also lives with her. Nargis has been a merchant for 6 years. She has a stall in the city's central market, where she sells women's clothing. Nargis is intent on increasing her sales. She is requesting a loan to buy an assortment of seasonal women's clothing. She plans to expand her retail business.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of seasonal women's clothing

loans.name: Parmonqul

texts.ru: Пармонкул житель города Турсунзаде. Ему 53 года. Он женат и имеет троих детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Старший сын занимается предоставлением услуги такси, а второй сын уехал на заработки в Россию. У Пармонкула среднее образование. Он занимается животноводством, а именно купле-продажей крупного рогатого скота. Пармонкул занимается этим бизнесом уже 13 лет. Одновременно Пармонкул занимается выращиванием сельхозкультуры, а также продажей топлива. Кредит запрашивает для своей животноводческой деятельности - для купли и продажи крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Parmonkul lives in Tursunzade. He is 53, married, and has three children. His wife is a homemaker. His oldest son operates a taxi services, and a second son is working in Russia. Parmonkul has a high school education. He is involved in animal husbandry; in particular he raises and sells cattle. He has been in this business for 13 years. Parmonkul also farms and sells fuel. He is requesting a loan for his livestock business — to buy, raise, and then resell cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is 22 years old and lives in Sana`a, Yemen with his parents. He has been selling perfumes and cosmetic materials in the main market, which is the only source of income for the family. He did not complete his education because he had to provide for his family. 

Mohammed's shop is not running well due to the lack of money to expand his business, so he is unable to fulfill the demands of his customers. He wants to offer more variety in his shop so that he can fulfill his customers' demands more professionally. He is requesting a youth loan from AMB for 150,000 YER, which he will use to purchase perfumes and cosmetic materials for his shop.  With the profit, Mohammed will expand his business so that he can get married.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes and cosmetic materials for his shop.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
This is 36-year-old Aminata. She is married and has three children, aged 19, 16 and 13 yearrs. 

In 2005, Aminata established her drinks business. She began her business because she wanted to help in taking care of her family. Her business is located in the outskirts and her main customers are women and children. Working seven days a week and 16 hours a day, she earns about SLL 800,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Aminata requires a loan in order to buy more drinks for resale. In the future, Aminata plans to build a house and to give high-quality educations to her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more drinks for resale.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
This is 28-year-old Alfred. He is married and has one child, aged 8 years. 

In 2005, Alfred established his pharmacy business. He began his business because he wanted to help himself. His business is located in outskits and his main customers are people living in his community. Working seven days a week and 15 hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,200,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 6,000,000. Alfred requires a loan in order to buy more medicine for resale. In the future, Alfred plans to further improve his business stock and have more profit. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more drugs for resale.

loans.name: Ngo

texts.en: Ngo would like to take a further loan to buy more haircare and cosmetic products to better satisfy her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy haircare and cosmetic products to better satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Vu

texts.en:
Vu, 60 years old, is married and has two sons and one daughter. He and his wife support their family through the income they earn from running a general store. They began this business eight years ago. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Vu intends to take a loan to increase his working capital and buy household items, food and soft drinks to stock his store. The additional materials will enable him to increase his sales. He hopes his business continues to run smoothly and will help him to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To buy food, soft drinks and household items for selling.

loans.name: Linh

texts.en:
Linh is 31 years old and married with two children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income as a driver for hire. Linh runs a cafe to earn a living. 

She started her business ten years ago. She intends to take a loan to gradually expand her business by buying a variety of different beverages to sell to her customers. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Nidian

texts.es: Nidian de 53 años, vive en Soledad y es madre de 3 hijos en las edades de 16, 24 y 30 años respectivamente. Ella tiene una miscelánea donde vende diversas mercancías y también se dedica parte de la mañana a preparar y vender almuerzos. Ambos negocios generan ingresos con los que ha generado cada día un mayor bienestar para sus hogares. Su vida como comerciante inició hace 6 años, vendiendo productos mediante guías especializadas, su negocio paulatinamente ha ido creciendo y por eso ha vinculado a él vitrinas, donde se ven bien exhibidos sus productos. Adicionalmente vende dulces, minutos a celulares, que se constituyen en otros ingresos, aprovechando a su clientela cautiva, que la visita día a día. Realiza las ventas de contado y a crédito, estudiando bien a su clientela. Los productos de dulcería y los insumos para preparar almuerzos, los adquiere en el centro de la ciudad de Barranquilla de contado, mientras las mercancías que ofrece en sus catálogos las adquiere a crédito. Su meta mas adelante, es hacer un local de mayor tamaño, donde funcione solamente su negocio, pero su gran desafio es lograr tener un fondo de efectivo suficiente para ampliar su negocio, responder a su clientela y tener siempre bien surtida su miscelánea. Nidian está aplicando a su segundo financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con su anterior finaciamiento pudo comprar productos cosméticos por catalogo, dulcería e insumos en mayor volumen para producir aun mas alimentos, así mismo adquirió tres vitrina y 4 mesas, con lo que pudo exhibir mejor su mercancia para impactar el deseo de compra de su clientela. Su éxito en esta inversión radica en su experiencia y que además su compra responde a los pedidos de su clientela y a la rotación actual de sus productos. Hoy se ha acercado a la Fundación para acceder a un credikiva, con el que comprará un refrigerador y una fotocopiadora, ella le agradece a Kiva y a la Fundación por ayudarla a salir adelante y está muy felíz con el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Nidian is 53 years old. She lives in Soledad and is mother to three children who are 16, 24 and 30 years old, respectively. She has a shop where she sells diverse merchandise and also dedicates part of her mornings to preparing and selling lunches. Both businesses generate income with has every day generated a greater wellbeing for her home. Her life as businesswoman started six years ago, selling products through specialized guides. Her business has been gradually growing and, as a result, she has attached glass cases where she can exhibit her products.

Additionally, she sells sweets, cellular minutes, which constitute other income, taking advantage of her captive customers who visit her daily. She makes her sales with cash and credit, studying her customers well. She acquires the sweet and the ingredients to prepare the lunches in the center of the city of Barranquilla with cash. Meanwhile, the merchandise that she offers from catalogs she acquires with credit. Her goal for the future is to build a bigger sized shop where only her business operates. But her great challenge is to have enough cash to fund the expansion of her business, respond to her customers and to always have her shop well stocked. Nidian is applying for her second credit with the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo. With her previous loan, she was able to buy catalog cosmetic products, sweets, and ingredients in large volumes to produce more food. Also, she acquired three glass cases and four tables with which she could exhibit her merchandise better to impact the customers' desire to buy. Her success in this investment lies in her experience and also her purchase is a response to her customers' requests and to the current rotation of her products. Today, she has approached the Foundation to request a CrediKiva with which she will buy a refrigerator and a photocopier. She is thankful to Kiva and to the Foundation for helping her get ahead and she is happy for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and a photocopier.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa is a 51-year-old married man living in Ho Chi Minh City. He has four children. 

Hoa and his wife earn a living running a food stall, which they have done for 15 years. 

Hoa would like to take loan to buy food ingredients and good quality food to serve his customers. He hopes this will enable him to better meet the needs of his existing customers and attract additional customers. He also hopes that through the loan his business will generate a higher income and will help him to improve his family's living conditions and enable him to save money to meet any future difficulties.

loans.use: To buy food ingredients and good quality food to serve his customers.

loans.name: Sarita

texts.en:
Sarita is 32 years old. She is married and has one child, aged 9.  

In 2000, she established her tailoring business. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, she supports her family. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order. Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines. These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the the traditional women's kurta surwal and men's daura surwal. With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth material or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability. 

Sarita has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy materials for her business. In the future, Sarita plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy materials for her business.

loans.name: Lien

texts.en:
Lien runs a stall where she sells coffee and soft drinks. She used a previous loan to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. 

Lien is requesting a loan to buy more beverages and good quality coffee to stock her store and better satisfy her customers. She hopes that her loan will help to increase the size of her business, attract new customers, and increase sales. Lien hopes that her loan will improve her income and her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy beverages and good quality coffee to better satisfy her customers

loans.name: Thu

texts.en:
Thu works making clothing. She used her previous loan to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. 

Thu is requesting a new loan to buy better quality materials to make clothing. She hopes that her loan will assist her to increase the size of her business, attract new customers, and increase her sales. Thus also hopes that her loan will improve her income and her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy better quality materials to make clothing

loans.name: Haykush

texts.en: Haykush is 60 years old, widowed, and has two adult children.  She lives in Vandzor.  She has studied at the Polytechnic Institute at the Chemistry Department. After graduating, she has worked in the local factory. Now Haykush has a food selling business, which she has been doing for 10 years. She has her own small stall, where she sells food and household products. Haykush is requesting a loan for 350.000 Armenian drams, which she will use to purchase assorted products for her stall.

loans.use: to purchase assorted products for her stall.

loans.name: Sau

texts.en:
Sau, 53, is married and has five children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns money through selling wood coal. 

Sau has been running a business of buying and selling clothes as a wholesaler for three years. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more and different clothes to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her children to school.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Chau

texts.en:
Chau is requesting another loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock his general store. This purchase will help him to better meet the needs of his customers. His previous loan enabled him to improve his business and offer his customers a greater variety of products.

He hopes that this loan will assist him in increasing the size of his store and increase sales, and will also help him to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy many kinds of goods, such as food and beverages, to stock his store

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en: Thuy would like to take a further loan to buy a camera to meet her customers's demands. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers, and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a new camera for her photo lab.

loans.name: Quyen

texts.en: Quyen is requesting a new loan to buy more cloth and sewing materials to process clothing for sale to wholesalers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business, processing capacity and sales. Quyen hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business and her income, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy more cloth and sewing materials to process clothing for sale to wholesalers.

loans.name: Temurali

texts.ru:
Темурали проживает в городе Душанбе. Ему 55 лет. Темурали живет с женой и сыновьями. У него двое детей. Его сыновья взрослые и самостоятельны. Они работают и обеспечивают свою семью. Темурали имеет высшее образование. Он более тридцати лет проработал бухгалтером. Сейчас Темурали на пенсии. После стольких лет работы он не может сидеть дома без дела. 
Знакомые Темурали предложили ему обратится в МЗО "Хумо и Партнеры" за кредит с низкими процентными ставками для открытия собственного бизнеса. Темурали узнав, с радостью обратился в Хумо с целью получения займа для приобретения автомашины, чтобы работать таксистом. У Темурали имеются водительские права, так как на своей работе он водил служебную машину. Еще у него имеется сбережение, которое он хочет потратить вместе с кредитом на приобретение автомашины. Он очень ждет от Вас поддержки!
texts.en:
Temurlali lives in Dushanbe. He is 55, and lives with his wife and two sons. His sons are adults and live on their own; they have jobs and provide for their families. Temurlali has a college diploma. He worked for more than thirty years as a bookkeeper, and is now retired. After so many years of working, he cannot stand staying at home with nothing to do.

Some friends suggested that Temurlali go to MLO Humo and Partners for a loan with a low interest rate to open his own business. So he went to Humo with the goal of obtaining a loan to buy a car so he could work as a taxi driver. He drove a car as part of his previous job, so he already has a driver's license. He has some savings which he would like to spend along with the loan to buy a car. He eagerly awaits your assistance!

loans.use: To buy a car and become a taxi driver

loans.name: Alhaji Amadu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! Thank you for supporting Alhaji with his boutique, where he sells clothing, shoes and shirts. 

He used the loan to buy clothing, shoes, shirts, men's polo shirts, ladies' bags, etc., for resale. The entire loan was used to buy all his items that are in demand. 

Alhaji says his business improved with the loan. He noted that weather condition affected his business during the loan cycle. Alhaji's goals and dreams are to become an International businessman. He wishes to tell Kiva lenders thanks.

loans.use: to buy more clothing shoes and shirts for resale.

loans.name: Shahr Zad Group

texts.en:
Shahr-Zad consists of four ladies from Taiz, Yemen. They have requested a group loan of 230,000 YER, and they will hold each other accountable for the loan repayment.

Samira is a 33-year-old woman. She is a very kind person, hard-working and enthusiastic. She is an employee getting a low salary that is not enough to cover her expenses. Unfortunately she was unable to buy what she needs because of a lack of economic resources. 

She intends to buy furniture to use for her house. She applied for a loan of 80,000 YER from AMB. With this loan, she will live a comfortable life. She hopes to accumulate money to improve the life conditions of her family and open a savings account.

loans.use: to buy furniture to use for her house.

loans.name: Quynh

texts.en:
Quynh is 55 years old and is married. She has two daughters and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works in a local company.

She has run a food stall and a beauty salon at her house for 15 years. She intends to use her loan to buy hair care machines and products to meet her customers' demands.

She hope her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and save money for emergencies.

loans.use: To buy some hair care machines and products.

loans.name: Nhan

texts.en:
Nhan, 45, is married and has four children, three sons and a daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income as a driver for hire. 

Nhan started a food stall six years ago. She sells meals for people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of food to sell at her stall and better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy food such as rice and meat to make meals for selling from her stall.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong works making clothing and other products. She used her previous loan to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family.

Phuong is requesting a new loan to buy more, better quality sewing materials to sell from her stall. She hopes that her loan will assist her to increase the size of her business, attract new customers, and increase sales. Phuong also hopes that her loan will improve her income and her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy better quality sewing materials

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Lan works running a food stall. She used her previous loan to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family.

Lan is requesting a another loan to buy many kinds of food to sell to her customers. She hopes that her loan will assist her to increase her business, attract new customers, and increase sales. Lan also hopes that her loan will improve her income and her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy many kinds of food to sell to her customers

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Hong is requesting another loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that this loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Hong is requesting another loan to buy materials for producing slipper molds. Hong's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy metal materials for making slipper molds.

loans.name: Ngoc

texts.en: Ngoc is requesting another loan to buy a greater variety of products, specifically foods and household items, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that this loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of products, specifically foods and household items.

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Van is requesting a new loan to buy quality food for her food stall so that she can serve a good quality for her customers. This purchase will help her to better attract and satisfy her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her food stall and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase good quality food

loans.name: Cuc

texts.en:
Cuc works running a general store. She used her previous loan to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. 

Cuc is requesting a new loan to buy many kinds of soft drinks to stock her store. She hopes that her loan will assist her to increase her business, attract new customers, and increase sales. Cuc also hopes that her loan will increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks to stock her store

loans.name: Al-Hasna Group

texts.en:
Al-Hasna group consists of six women from Taiz, Yemen.  They applied for a loan of 175,000 YER from AMB.

Mriam is the leader of the group. She is 30 years old and single, living with her relative in Taiz. She did not complete her education and studied till the elementary school. All the family live in a poor area and It is very difficult and uncomfortable for them. 

Mriam accumulated a small amount of money to sell potatoes, fruit and other food items, getting a low income.  She would like to expand her business but she doesn't have the money to buy potatoes and fruit and another food items. Therefore, she asked for a 30,000 YER loan to buy potatoes, fruit and other food items to expand her business. In future, she hopes to improve her living conditions and open a savings account.

loans.use: to buy potatoes and fruit and other food items to expand her business.

loans.name: Greta

texts.en: Greta is 56 years old and lives with her unemployed husband in the village of Ddmashen in the region of Gegharkunik. Their two sons are married and live separately with their families. Greta doesn't have a higher education and both her husband and she have been engaged in farming and agriculture for many years. They have a piece of land where they cultivate potatoes. They also have three cows, two calves, five sheep, two piglets and eleven chickens on their farm. Greta is requesting a loan for the first time. She needs 520,000 Armenian drams to buy animal fodder and seeds of potato. She really hopes that this deal with Kiva and Nor Horizon will bring a better income to her family and in future she can again cooperate with Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy animal fodder and seeds of potato

loans.name: Hayko

texts.en: Hayko is 52 years old and lives in Gavar with his wife and school-aged son. It is already seven years since he and his wife, who is unemployed, began farming. Their farm is very scant, since they have only two cows, three sheep, one piglet and ten chickens. They want to expand their farm and in this way to improve their poor living conditions. Hayko needs a loan of 800,000 Armenian drams to buy two more cows. He hopes to receive a a good income for his family as a result of this loan. On this occasion he is really relying on the kindness of Kiva lenders and hopes to cooperate with them again.

loans.use: To buy two more cows in order to expand his cattle breeding

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Van is requesting a new loan to buy materials for producing shoe molds. Van's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy materials for making shoe molds

loans.name: Ratna Shova

texts.en:
Ratna Shova is 47 years old.  She is married and has two children aged 29 and 25.  In 2000, she established  her tailoring business.  Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy raw materials for her business.  

In the future, Ratna Shova plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order.  Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines.  These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the the traditional women's 'kurta surwal' and men's 'daura surwal'.  With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth, materials or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her business

loans.name: Hamlet

texts.en:
Hamlet is a 36-year-old farmer who lives in the village of Geghamavan in the region of Gegharkunik. He lives with his wife, two children (daughter and son) and his retired mother. 

For many years Hamlet worked in the contractual military service, but for ten years now, Hamlet has been engaged in farming and agriculture. Hamlet’s wife doesn't work and helps him around the farm. They have a not small private piece of land, where they cultivate potatoes, carrots, cucumbers, tomatoes, etc. They also have a lot of animals in their farm: six cows, three calves, one bull, one piglet, eight sheep and twenty chickens. Hamlet’s wife is a very kind lady and all the work she does in their farm, she does with care and love. 

Hamlet is asking for a loan of 450.000 Armenian drams to buy potato seeds and fertilizer for his vegetable garden. Hamlet hopes for the support of Kiva lenders and Nor Horizon.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and fertilizer for his vegetable garden

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane is a very nice young lady who manages farming and agriculture all alone. She is 25 years old, and with her two little children she lives in the village of Tsovagyugh in the region Gegharkunik. Like many other men in their village, Gayane’s husband also had to go to the Russian Federation in an effort to find work abroad in order to lighten and support Gayane with their family care. 

Gayane graduated from Sevan Medical College and she has the qualification of nurse, but she has never worked. Farming is the main source of money for the family. They have a perfect vegetable plot and a colorful fruit garden. Gayane also manages the care of their abundance of farm animals, consisting of three cows, one bull, two calves, one young piglet and twenty-two chickens.

She is asking for a loan of 600,000 Armenian drams to buy fodder for the farm animals and also vegetable and fruit seedlings. It is the first time that she has dealt with Kiva and she hopes that it will be continued.

loans.use: To buy fodder for farm animals and also vegetable and fruit seedlings.

loans.name: Lang

texts.en: Lang is a 56-year-old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has one daughter. She and her husband have earned a living selling noodles for 25 years. Lang would like to take out a loan to buy a greater quantity of ingredients and good quality food to stock her food stall and serve good meals to her customers. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity of ingredients and good quality food to stock her food stall and serve good meals to her customers

loans.name: Cuong

texts.en:
Cuong, a 57-year-old married man, lives in Ho Chi Minh City. He and his wife run a business that sells and processes motorbike spare parts to people in their local community.

Cuong requests a loan to purchase more motorbike spare parts. That will enable him to offer a better range of products and services to his customers. He hopes his business will run smoothly and he can earn additional income to reinvest in his shop and save for emergencies.

loans.use: To purchase more motorbike spare parts

loans.name: Oanh

texts.en:
Oanh, 44, is married and has three daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn an income by producing plastic materials. 

She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a large quantity of raw resin to stock for producing plastic materials so she can attract more customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of raw resin to stock for producing plastic materials so she can attract more customers

loans.name: Dúo Cristo Vive Group

texts.es:
DÚO CRISTO VIVE
El grupo está conformado por la señora María Consuelo tiene 43 años de edad el negocio que tiene es una tienda de productos comestibles de consumo diarios (pastas, jabón, etc.) desde hace 8 años tiene su negocio y  necesita otro crédito para poder surtir de mas marcaderia en la compra  de maíz y frijol  y algunos productos  de consumo diario el deseo de ella es seguir creciendo con su negocio  para  sacar adelante  a sus  3 hijos, espera que le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en: One of the two members of the Cristo Vive group is 43-year old María Consuelo. She has run a store selling groceries such as pasta, soap etc. for eight years. Now she needs another loan to buy more stock for her store such as corn, beans, and other daily necessities. Marīa’s greatest wish is to continue growing her store so that she can help her three children get ahead. She hopes that the loan she is seeking will be forthcoming.

loans.use: buy groceries for her store

loans.name: Dila

texts.en:
This is Dila, dressed as always in her northern traditional wear. You will find the majority of women past their 40’s dressed this way in the rural north. Dila is in her early sixties and married with grownup children. Before arriving at her current location, she had resided in the very deep rural area of Albania. 

“I have been taking care of dairy animals for a very long time, let’s say forever. I sell fresh milk and make cheese and yogurt at home, but all I sell is milk and cheese because everyone in Albania makes their own yogurt at home,” she said.

“I want to expand the stable you see here and this loan will help me achieve this,“ Dila said, showing the building in the background of the picture.

loans.use: To expand the animal stable.

loans.name: Ammar

texts.en:
Ammar is a 35-year-old married man and a father of one child. He lives with his family in Sana`a, Yemen. He is a worker who gets a small salary which is not enough to cover the family's needs, but at the same time he is trying to offer better living conditions to his family.

He is requesting a 100,000 YER loan from AMB to cover the cost of purchasing a fridge and a washing machine for his house. Taking this loan will offer him and his family comfort so they can enjoy living in their house.

loans.use: to cover the cost of purchasing a fridge and a washing machine for his house.

loans.name: Nexhmije

texts.en:
Nexhmije is requesting this loan, which will be the second one for her, to buy pesticides for her planted veggies and corn seeds to plant. All the plants you see around her in the photograph are where she plants. In the photo she’s wearing an apron, and this is sort of a tradition in southeastern Albania where she lives.  

She plants different kinds of veggies and sells them to locals, but she sells corn in quantity to wholesalers. "Sometimes the weather is too hot or too cold which destroys the plants; but anyway, nothing we can do,” Nexhmije said, smiling. She is married and has three children in their early twenty’s.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds to plant and pesticides for the veggies.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Lan, 37, is married and has two sons. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income working as a mechanic. Lan has been running a general store that sells food and household items to people in her community for 7 years. 

She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety and quantity of new products such as food and beverages to stock her store and better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety and quantity of new products such as food and beverages to stock her store

loans.name: Eugene

texts.en:
Eugene  is a 51-year-old man from Muhanga District in the Southern Province of Rwanda. 

He is seeking a loan of  30,000 RWF (Rwandan francs) to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100. 

Eugene started selling lights in February 2012, and he has sold 20 lights to date, providing clean energy to 100 people. With the money he makes from selling and recharging lights, he will improve his adobe brick home where he lives with his wife and his grandchildren.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel highly appreciates the assistance given to him by Kiva that enabled him to purchase his first consignment of 100 LED lights.

He is now seeking a top-up loan of  30,000 RWF (Rwandan francs) to purchase 10 more rechargeable LED lights to sell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100. 

With the money he makes from selling and recharging lights, he will improve his adobe brick home where he lives with his wife, Beltirde, and his two children (Pacific and David).

loans.use: To pay for 20 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy soap, batteries, biscuits, chewing gum, etc., in bulk to add to his business.

loans.name: Enjellushe

texts.en:
Engjellushe wants to repair the damaged tractor that her husband uses for their field and also uses to help others in the village. This loan will help her achieve their goal.

She is fifty and has two children in their twenties. They live in southeastern Albania and three years ago she started investing time and money in agriculture.
 
“So far, it hasn’t disappointed me,” she said, smiling. “I have a dairy cow as well, but this fulfills only the family needs with dairy, that’s all. I want to add some more dairy animals to sell their products and generate some income. This is my plan for the future,” Engjellushe continued.

loans.use: To repair the damaged tractor.

loans.name: Besniko

texts.en:
A loan of 100,000 Albanian Lek (ALL) will help Besniko buy some parts for his damaged tractor. Besniko is a 33-year-old married father of three children, all under the age of five. They live in rural central Albania where he practices his skills in plowing the land or turning the soil after harvesting with the tractor you see in the picture. 

He gets paid for this service and the money he gets in return is not bad, according to him. He lived and worked in Greece for a long time and now he is back investing time and money in his little business that he hopes will turn out to be profitable in some ways, despite the difficulties at first. He has already established a clientele and he is already happy about it.

loans.use: To buy parts to repair his tractor

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is from Verishen village, where she lives with her husband and daughter. Their family has been running a farm for 5 years. They keep 8 cows and 5 oxen and cultivate potatoes and cucumbers. 

Anna runs the farm with great love and care, and her husband sells the gathered harvest locally. The farming business is the only source of the family's income, so Anna and her husband would like to expand it.

Anna has applied to SEF International for this loan to purchase 3 cows and forage for feeding the livestock. The loan is important for Anna and her family to enlarge their farm and earn more income.

loans.use: to pay for 3 cows and forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Trinh

texts.en:
Trinh is a 35-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and daughter in Ho Chi Minh City. To support her family, Trinh earns an income by running a business of making and selling clothing. She started this business 10 years ago. 

Trinh would like to take a loan to expand her current business. With the loan, she will buy a greater variety and quantity of fabric and sewing materials to make clothes to sell. 

Trinh hopes that through the loan, her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to set aside some savings.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety and quantity of fabric and sewing materials to make clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anh

texts.en:
Anh, 46, is married and has one son. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn an income running a general store in front of their house. 

Anh started this business 10 years ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater quantity of food and beverages to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity of food and beverages to better satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Ruseli

texts.es: Ruseli, de 42 años de edad, es una mujer amable y muy responsable, está casada con Alfredo y tiene 3 hijos de 22, 18 y 9 años de edad respectivamente, tiene su casa propia la cual pudo comprar junto a su esposo.El trabajo de Ruseli consiste en la venta de productos comestibles al por menor, es decir compra los productos en grandes cantidades y de ahí se encarga de venderlos al menudeo. Tiene una pequeña tienda instalada en un espacio de su casa la misma que pudo construir gracias al apoyo de su esposo. Entre los productos que ofrece tiene arroz, azúcar, huevos, aceite, enlatados, bebidas gaseosas, condimentos y otros. Este trabajo lo realiza desde hace 5 años, gracias a esta actividad pudo educar a sus hijos e implementar su casa con algunos artefactos. Complementa esta labor brindando servicio de peluquería en ciertas ocasiones ya que aún no tiene todos sus implementos de trabajo.Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene tiempo para realizar múltiples actividades dentro de su casa y le está yendo muy bien ya que siempre tiene clientes que atender, sus ganancias son considerables y eso le permite realizar la compra de sus productos de manera continua.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000, por ello agradece la oportunidad que le brindan para que pueda concretar sus planes laborales. Con el monto solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de abarrotes como arroz, pan, azúcar, huevos, verduras entre otros, además comprará pintura para rediseñar su tienda.
texts.en:
42-year old Ruseli is a friendly, very responsible woman. She is married to Alfredo and has three children aged 22, 18, and 9. She has her own house which she and her husband were able to buy. Ruseli earns her living selling groceries which she buys in bulk and then sells in small quantities. The small store is located in her house and was built with help from her husband. She sells rice, sugar, eggs, oil, canned goods, soft drinks, condiments etc. It’s a job Ruseli has had for five years, and with the income she has been able to educate her children and buy some goods for her home. As well as running the store, Ruseli sometimes offers her services as a hairdresser although she does not yet have all the tools of the trade. She enjoys her job as she has time to do various other activities in the house. All is going well since she always has customers to serve, and her income is good allowing her to buy products on a continuous basis. 

Now Ruseli is seeking a loan of S/. 2000, an opportunity for which she is very grateful as it allows her to put into place her business plan. With the money she plans to buy a larger quantity of groceries such as rice, bread, sugar, eggs, and vegetables. She will also buy paint to decorate her store.

loans.use: buy products such as rice, bread, sugar etc.

loans.name: Teresa De Los Angeles

texts.es: Doña Teresa, madre trabajadora busca como salir adelante con su familia, hoy en día tiene  su pareja que la acompaña y le ayuda en todo, sus hijos son ya mayores de edad e independientes, ella continúa con su pequeño negocio de ventas variadas como gaseosas, refrescos, ropa cosméticos entre otros, está muy contenta por haber invertido sus créditos en mejoras de su casa, pero aun le falta mejoras las condiciones del servicio sanitario por lo que con este nuevo crédito lo usara para instalar inodoro y mejorar las condiciones,  para tener un poco mas de comodidad con la familia.
texts.en:
Teresa, a hardworking mother, is trying to get ahead with her family.  Currently she has her partner who shares and helps her with everything.  Her children are already adults and independent.

She continues with her small business selling a variety of products such as soda, refreshments, clothing, cosmetics, and other things.

She'll use this new loan to install a toilet and improve her conditions so she has a little more comfort with her family.

loans.use: to buy a toilet, accessories, cement, cinder blocks, and rebar

loans.name: Al-Amany Group

texts.en:
Al-Amany group consists of five female ladies from Sana`a, Yemen. They have requested a loan of 240,000 YER from AMB.

Amany is a 31-year-old married woman and she has four children. They all live in Sana`a. She had some training courses in sewing, and now she has the ability and skills needed to start up her business as a dressmaker. She works hard to provide for her family. She needs now to buy all sewing requirements, like a sewing machine, and so on. 

Therefore she requested a loan of 50,000 YER to help her buy these materials. She wishes to open a saving account in AMB when she makes a good profit and becomes a well-known dressmaker in the future.

loans.use: to buy all sewing requirements, like a sewing machine and so on, for her business.

loans.name: Tamba Joseph's Group

texts.en:
Tamba Joseph's Group consists of secondary school teachers from Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan from SMT for 4,500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) in order to meet their immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month, they will repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for making the repayments on their behalf.

Tamba is the leader of this group. A native of Niagbwema, Tamba is 54 years old, married, and has seven children, four of whom attend primary and secondary schools. Tamba has been a teacher for 34 years. He has requested this loan in order to buy house building materials such as iron corrugated sheets, cements, etc. for the construction of a house.

loans.use: to purchase house building materials such as iron corrugated sheets, cements, etc. for the construction of a house

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Here is Naomi, a small-scale businesswoman in Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. Naomi sells market food – onions, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), tomatoes, etc. She has been doing business for many years now. With a loan of 4,000,000 SLL (Sierra Leone leones) she will buy onions, margi seasoning, tomatoes, etc., in bulk to add to her business.
 
Naomi is married. Her husband is a trader, too; three of her children are attending primary schools, and the other is in secondary school. Out of the daily profits she makes, Naomi is able to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy onions, margi seasoning, tomatoes, etc., in bulk to add to her business.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you Fatmata, a small-scale entrepreneur who has come to SMT/Kiva lenders to request a loan of 5,000,000 SLL (Sierra Leone leones) in order to invest in her business. 

Fatmata sells building materials, chairs, etc. She has been in business for 31 years now in the city of Koidu, in eastern Sierra Leone. Fatmata is a wife and a mother of four children; three of her children are attending primary and secondary schools. 

Fatmata has requested this loan in order to add more inventory into her business. She will use this loan to buy building materials and chairs in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy cement, iron, corrugated zinc, chairs, etc., to add to her business.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es:
Leonardo tiene 59 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene tres hijos. Desde hace 32 años se dedica la agricultura; antes cultivaba algodón, estas actividades se las enseño su padre desde que era muy pequeño. Para comprar los insumos agrícolas, se reúnen varios vecinos, para compartir los gastos de trasporte ya que pagan un vehiculo particular para que les realice el viaje que son 43 kilómetros. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar pesticidas, herbicidas, semilla, abono y pago de mano de obra para cultivar maíz, fríjol y maicillo. Con a inversión cultivara a tiempo, ya que el invierno esta muy cerca y si siembra en este momento su cosecha será buena.
