This is the second time that Felipe has sought a loan from IMPRO and the first time from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy cement and bricks to repair the stable so that his dairy cows are better protected and produce improved milk.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a single mother of two children who both go to school. She also takes care of three cousins. She has a business selling bananas and has been in this line of work for 10 years. She works from her home seven days a week and has applied for a loan of 1,600,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy more of bunches of green bananas. She generates additional income through selling used clothes. Her major business challenges include seasonality thieves and defaulters. She is aspiring of becoming a wholesaler and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Gladis Tomasa

texts.es:
Doña Gladis es una mujer de 34 años de edad casada y madre de 4 hijos los cuales juntos en familia se dedican a la siembra y cultivo de maíz, frijol y café. Ella tiene un grado de educación de primaria no completado el cual pudo cursar con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio hasta el 4 grado y no pudo continuar por falta de ayuda económica ya que sus padres son de bajos recursos económicos por lo cual las entradas de efectivo las distribuían realizando la compra de los alimentos para el sustento de su familia. Fueron ellos los que le enseñaron dicha actividad la cual la ejerce hace 10 años y que hasta hoy en día sigue practicando ya que es el único medio de ingreso y sustento para su familia. El terreno que ellos cultiva lo adquirió gracias a una herencia por parte de los padres de su conyugue el cual les ha dado mucho fruto ubicado en la misma propiedad donde ellos habitan eso les facilita estar al pendiente para su mantenimiento, asistencia y limpia de sus cultivos. Su producto es comercializado y vendido por los diferentes intermediarios que llegan a la comunidad para su adquisición.

Actualmente ella solicita ayuda para la compra de fertilizante y abono para sus cultivos de café el cuales les permitirá mantener limpio de plagas y de enfermedades las cuales destruyen cultivos completos de no ser tratados a tiempo.

Su sueño es seguir aumentando su cultivó para de esa manera generar más ingresos que le permitan seguir invirtiendo en su producción de café ya que uno de los más grandes desafíos es el constante aumento y el alza de los precios de los insumos mismos que son de gran ayuda para que la producción se pueda aprovechar en un 100% esto permitirá darle una mejor educación a sus hijos y mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Gladis, 34, is married and the mother of four children; as a family, they all work together growing corn, beans and coffee.  She did not complete elementary school; with much effort and sacrifice she was able to complete 4th grade but was unable to go further for lack of economic support because her parents are of low income and the cash they did earn had to go for food and family support.  They taught her said activity that she’s been going for ten years and still continues to this day; it’s the only source of support and income for her family.  

The parcel of land she grows on was acquired thanks to an inheritance from her spouse’s parents; it’s produced much fruit and it’s located on the same premises where they live which makes providing maintenance, assistance and weed clearing of their crop much easier.  They market and sell their product to various middlemen who come to the community to buy it.

She’s currently asking for help to buy fertilizer and manure for her coffee crop so that it will be free of infestations and illnesses that can destroy entire harvests if they aren’t treated on time.

Her dream is to continue increasing her crop so that more income will be generated to continue investing in coffee production since one of her constant challenges is the ever increasing price of supplies that are of great help for production to be 100% useful.  This will make it possible for her to give her children a better level of education as well as improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Dennys

texts.es:
Desde hace 10 años, Dennys aprendió el tema de emprendimiento en su propio taller de confecciones, al cual dio apertura en Junio del año 2003, cuando una amiga, diseñadora de modas, y actual socia, le propuso que confeccionaran y vendieran ropa masculina y especialmente camisas bordadas. La idea fue todo un éxito,  así que hoy se dedican  a la elaboración  de estas hermosas prendas especialmente de guayaberas, camisa masculina delicadamente bordada, que es suelta y de tela ligera y se lleva por fuera de los pantalones.
Sus principales clientes son amigos y vecinos y también compradores, a los que ha accedido a través de las redes de internet, a quienes les vende de contado. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, doceavo crédito que ha recibido de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará telas para camisas, y para pagar mano de obra, debido  a que contrata los servicios de maquila con talleres externos. Su meta más adelante es abrir un local al público y aumentar sus utilidades, con el propósito de invertir en la educación de sus 3 hijos, generándole posibilidades de acceder a una educación de calidad, sueño de prosperidad que Dennys no abandona.
texts.en:
Ten years ago, Dennys undertook a business venture in her own sewing workshop, which she opened in June 2003, when her friend, fashion designer and  current business partner suggested they start making and selling men's clothing, especially embroidered shirts.  The idea was a great success and they still make these beautiful items today, especially 'guayabera' shirts (a delicately embroidered, loose-fitting men's shirt made from lightweight material which is not worn tucked in).  Her main customers are friends and neighbors but she also has buyers who she has reached through the Internet and who she sells to for cash.  

Dennys is currently applying for a Kiva loan (her 12th loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo) to buy fabric for making her shirts.  She will also pay workers as she contracts out some of the assembly work to external workshops.  Her goal for the future is to open a store and to increase her profits with the aim of investing in her three kids' education.  This will make it possible for them to receive a top-quality education.  Dennys will not give up this dream of prosperity.

loans.use: to buy fabric for making shirts and to pay workers

loans.name: Mayada Group

texts.en:
Soukayna is the featured borrower of Mayada's Group. She has joined with the other group members to apply for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua because they have always been neighbors and friends.

Soukayna is a 45-year-old married woman and is the mother of four children. She has been working as a tailor for the last four years to help her husband, who works as a taxi driver, to improve their living conditions and to cover their children's education and expenses.

Soukayana is a hard worker. She is well known in her region and recommended by her customers, who started off being her relatives and neighbors and now are expanding to include friends-of-friends and those from nearby areas.

This loan will be used to buy a new tailoring machine that will develop her business in a well managed way. She is the first from the right in the photograph.

Rana is the second from the left. She is a 26-year-old married woman, who is the mother of two children. She has been working as a school principal since thirteen years ago. Her portion of the loan will be invested in buying a laptop for her son, which will help him in his school research and studies.

Ghida is the first from the left. She is a 26-year-old married woman, and she has three children. She has been working as an employee in a shoe shop for three years to help her husband to cover their family's expenses. Her portion of the loan will be used to pay for her children's school fees.

Mayada is a 49-year-old married woman with two children. She has been working selling glass cups, plates and other household items for three years. Her portion of the loan will be invested in increasing her business capital with special designs and discount products.

loans.use: To buy a new developed tailoring machine

loans.name: Sandra Mercedes

texts.es:
Sandra, 52 años de edad,  es originaria de León pero tiene 28 años de vivir en Managua , casada , madre de tres hijos solo su hija menor de 13 años está a cargo de ella los otros dos viven independiente. 
Ella se dedica a vender ropa usada y joyas de plata. Inicio con la venta de joyas de plata a los 40 años después una amiga le sugirió que agregara la venta de ropa usada y nueva por temporada vendió perfumes poco a poco fue consiguiendo capital para comprar mercadería. Actualmente vende ropa, joyas de plata y vende comida los fines de semana es así como mantiene a su familia.  
Está requiriendo el financiamiento para comprar ropa interior, ropa de vestir, joyas de plata, acero y ropa de cama. Para vender durante esta víspera del día de las madres cuando las ventas suben y quiere aprovechar la oportunidad para conseguir buenos ingresos.  Uno de sus proyectos es poner una tienda de ropa en su casa.
texts.en:
Sandra, age 52, is originally from León but has lived in Managua for 28 years. She is married and the mother of three children. Her youngest daughter is 13 years old and still under her care, while the other two children live independently.

Sandra sells used clothing and silver jewelry. She started selling silver jewelry when she was 40. Afterwards, a friend suggested that she should also sell new and used clothing. Sandra sells perfumes on a seasonal basis. Over time, she gradually built up the capital to buy more merchandise. She currently sells clothes and silver jewelry, but she also sells food on the weekends so that she can support her family.

Sandra is requesting a loan so that she can buy undergarments, dress clothes, silver jewelry, steel, and bedding. She plans to sell during the eve of Mother’s Day when her sales increase, so she wants to take advantage of this opportunity in order to earn a good income. One of her goals is to open a clothing store in her house.

loans.use: to buy undergarments, dress clothes, silver jewelry, steel, and bedding.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years. She earns more income from buying and selling eggs and farming vegetables.

Letecia is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like soap, shampoo, canned goods, eggs, spices, etc. for her general store business.

Letecia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like soap, shampoo, canned goods, eggs, spices, etc.

loans.name: Julio  Cesar

texts.es: Julio de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos, es muy trabajador, siempre lo ha realizado con alegría y entusiasmo, se dedica a ser agricultor siembra todos los años los principales granos básicos de la zona como lo son, maíz y frijol.  Julio desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso visitó las oficinas de INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Julio, 37, lives in his own house with his wife and three children.  He’s very hardworking and has always worked joyfully and enthusiastically.  He works in agriculture and every year plants the main basic grains from the zone such as corn and beans.  

Julio wants to increase sales which is why he visited the Integral offices to request a loan that will make it possible for him to buy seeds, manure, fertilizer and pesticide, among others.  He wants to have the requested support because he has no other source of income and this way he will continue providing his home with daily bread with no limitation whatsoever.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm supplies.

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es: Doña Alba, una señora que busca como salir adelante como toda madre Nicaragüense, sus hijos son mayores de edad, unos trabajan y otros estudian a quienes siempre apoyan con su esposo, ambos comparten los gastos del hogar, ahora doña Alba a su venta de fritanga también le anexo la venta de cosméticos y reposterías, poco a poco espera ir creciendo para su estabilidad económica familiar ya que hoy en día los alimentos están más caros. Este crédito que solicita es para invertir en materia prima para su pequeño negocio.
texts.en:
Alba’s a woman who like all Nicaraguan mothers seeks ways to get ahead.  Her children are all adults; some work and others attend school.  She and her husband always support them and they both share household expenses.  

Alba has now added to her fast-food business the sale of cosmetics and pastry.  She hopes to gradually increase economic stability of her family since food is more expensive every day.  This loan she’s requesting will be to buy raw materials for her small business.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, flour, fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy hoops, bracelets, chains, etc.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
La Sra. Blanca tiene 39 años, está casada con el Sr. Aníbal hace más de 15 años  y vive en su casa propia en la  ciudad de Carapeguá, tienen 2 hijos ya mayores de edad que trabajan y son independientes a ellos.
Desde temprana edad  la Sra. Blanca empezó a ayudar a su madre a confeccionar colchas artesanales, de quién aprendió el oficio, también compra ropas en general para volver a venderlo, hoy en día ella misma lleva a  vender sus productos en la zona de la capital del país con la ayuda de su marido, gracias a este trabajo logró construir una modesta casa y también adquirió un vehículo para transportar mejor sus mercaderías, su trabajo también la ayudo a poder dar a sus hijos una buena crianza sin necesidades.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de sobrecamas, sabanas y hamacas para poder venderlas y dar a sus clientes mas novedades
texts.en:
Sra. Blanca is 39 years old and has been married to Sr. Aníbal for more than 15 years. They live in their own home in the city of Carapeguá. They have two grown children who work and are already independent.

At an early age, Sra. Blanca began helping her mother make handcrafted bedspreads. Even though she learned this trade, she also bought clothing for resale. Now she takes her products to the area around the national capital with the help of her husband so that she can sell them. Thanks to her work, she was able to build a modest house and acquire a vehicle for transporting her merchandise. Her work also enables her to provide her children a good upbringing without being deprived.

Blanca is requesting a loan in order to buy bedspreads, bed sheets, and hammocks that she can sell to her customers, which will also provide them with newer products.

loans.use: to buy bedspreads, bed sheets, and hammocks.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: Doña Virginia es una clienta que tiene 43 años de edad, vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos. Es una señora humilde, trabajadora y dedicada a su familia. Se enteró de los servicios que ofrece Fundación Mujer por medio de otra clienta y le pareció la idea. Ella comenzó a generar ingresos propios con la venta de pollo, refrescos gaseosos y golosinas. Ahora cuenta con una pulpería, logró cunplir su meta con el primer financiamiento que le otorgó FundaciÓn Mujer. Por ésta razón solicita su segundo préstamo a la Fundación, para reforzar su negocio. Cuenta con el apoyo de su familia y se propone cada día crecer más tanto a nivel personal como de negocio.
texts.en:
Virginia, 43, is a client who lives in a common-law marriage and has two children.  She's a modest and hardworking woman who's devoted to her family.

She found out about the services of Fundación Mujer through another client, and she liked the idea.  She began to generate her own income selling chicken, soda, and sweets.  Now she has a grocery store.

She managed to achieve her goal with her first loan from Fundación Mujer.  This is why she's requesting her second loan from Fundación Mujer to strengthen her business.

She has the support of her family and challenges herself to grow more every day both personally and in her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.es: Teresita es una mujer trabajado. ella desea mejorar económicamente la vida tanto de ella y de su familia, es por ello que solicita un préstamo de un millón de colones (1.000.000 para comprar ganado. Ella tiene mucha experiencia en este negocio por lo que el préstamo le va a ayudar a salir adelante.
texts.en: Teresita’s a working woman. She wants to improve her and her family’s life economically which is why she’s asking for a one-million colon loan to buy cattle.  She has much experience in this business which is why the loan will help her get ahead.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es: Esperanza es una señora emprendedora, tiene mucha experiencia en la producción de leche y productos lácteos. necesita de un préstamo de un millón treinta y cinco mil de colones (1.035.000) para comprar dos vacas lecheras más y así aumentar la producción de leche. Ella sabe que contar con mas vacas es un mayor sacrificio y demandará más trabajo pero esta muy feliz por la oportunidad. Con esto mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia
texts.en: Esperanza’s an enterprising woman. She has much experience as a milk and dairy products producer.  She needs a one-million-thirty-five-thousand colones (1,035,000) loan to buy two more dairy cows to increase milk production.  She knows that having more cows means a greater sacrifice and more work will be demanded from her but she’s happy for the opportunity.  With this, she will improve hers and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy dairy cows.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive en casa propia con sus hijos de 6 y 1 año de edad  es madre soltera. Ella posee un taller de costura en el lugar de su residencia donde confecciona diferentes tipos de prendas, últimamente se ha hecho de mucha clientela porque el trabajo que ella realiza es excelente y los elabora a precios realmente accesibles; ella es una mujer muy dedicada a su trabajo responsable y honesta. La clienta esta solicitando un crédito que le permita comprar: telas, hilos, agujas, y todo lo relacionado con la costura para seguir satisfaciendo la necesidad de los clientes y asi ella y su hijo podrán tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This member lives in her own home with her children, who are ages six and one. She is a single mother. She has a tailoring shop set up at home where she makes different kinds of clothing items. Her customer base has increased lately because her work is excellent and her prices are really affordable. She is a very honest and responsible woman and she is very dedicated to her work. 

She is requesting a loan in order to purchase fabric, thread, needles, and all sorts of sewing materials. This will allow her to continue to cover her customers' needs so that she and her son can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, needles, etc.

loans.name: Solidario Mary De Patzun Group

texts.es: Solidario Mary de Patzun, este grupo esta formado por la señora Mayra Elizabeth de 20 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de pan, en las mañanas y por la tardes, esta muy contenta porque su negocio dia con dia ba creciendo, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de arina y condimentos para la elaboracion y venta de pan espera que le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado ya que sera de mucha ayuda para ella y para su negocio.
texts.en:
Mary de Patzun Communal Bank

Mayra Elizabeth, 20, is part of this group.  She works selling bread mornings and afternoons.  She’s very happy because her business is growing every day.  She’s requesting this loan to buy flour and condiments needed to make and sell bread.  She hopes that you will be able to help her with the requested loan because it will be of great help for her and her business.

loans.use: to buy flour and other baking ingredients.

loans.name: Angela Romelia

texts.es: Doña Ángela Romelia de 33 años de edad,es madre de dos niños de 8 y 3 años de edad, es originaria del Municipio de San Juan,  doña Ángela ha heredado el negocio que su  madre  inicio hace mas de 35 años el cual es la venta de tortillas en su domicilio, gracias a la atención que ella brinda ha logrado que varias personas vecinos del sector y varios comedores  del mercado local  realicen su pedido en dos tiempos de comida, doña Ángela logran  elaborar dos quintales de maíz, produciendo así  una venta  entre (Q. 700 y 800) diarias, ahora  necesita de capital para la compra de leña en grandes cantidades ya que debido a la cercanía del invierno  necesita guardar lo suficiente para no tener problemas para su negocio en los días siguientes.
texts.en: Ángela Romelia, 33, is the mother of two children aged 8 and 3 years.  She’s from the town of San Juan and she inherited her business from her mother who started it 35 years ago; it’s selling tortillas at home.  Thanks to the attention she pays it she’s managed to get several people from the neighborhood and various food stalls in the market to order from her for two daily meals which means she processes two quintals worth of corn that means daily sales of between 700 and 800 quetzals.  She now needs capital to buy firewood in large amounts because due to the approaching winter she needs to stockpile enough in order not to have any business problems in the days to come.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood to make and sell tortillas.

loans.name: Maria Estela

texts.es: Maria, vive en la ciudad de Managua, casada, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de nacatamales, fue beneficiada con su primer crédito Kiva , el cual utilizo para invertirlo en su negocio, también compro ropa usada y bisutería para vender. Esta agradecida por el financiamiento que se le brindo pues le ha permitido mejorar sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su negocio. Hoy está necesitando este financiamiento para comprar vasos, platos de vidrio, blusas para damas, cremas, cosméticos. Todo alusivo al día de las madres que es una temporada muy buena para vender. Pues su meta es lograr poner una tienda de ropa usada.
texts.en: Maria lives in Managua.  She is married and works as a merchant, selling nacatamales.  She benefitted from her first Kiva loan and used it to invest in her business.  She also bought used clothing and costume jewelry to sell.  She is grateful for the fist loan which allowed her to increase her income and get her business ahead.  Now she needs this loan to buy glasses, plates, ladies' blouses creams, and cosmetics.  All this is for mothers day, which is a good time to sell.  Her goal is to open a used clothing store.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Ana Melva

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, ciudad de clima cálido y acogedor y sobretodo tiene una variedad de fauna silvestre muy hermosa y una gastronomía muy variada. Ana es una mujer que ha atravesado por omentos muy difíciles tiene 2 hijos y cuando ellos aun eran pequeños, su esposo la abandono y la dejo sola al cuidado de sus hijos. Desde ese momento se convirtió en madre y padre para ellos. Con el fin de poder tener ingresos Ana luego de mucho esfuerzo inicio su negocio de venta de productos de belleza y venta de ropa, Ana trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día y puede atender hasta 12 clientes diariamente y ella cree que está saliendo adelante en su negocio porque es amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque ofrece productos de calidad.

Ana está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar materiales como clavos, madera, clavos, mano de obra, entre otros para poder realizar mejoras en su vivienda ya que hay muchas lluvias y originas inundaciones en su vivienda, así mejorara  su calidad de vida y seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su  más grande sueño:” tener un salón de belleza”.
texts.en:
Ana is a hardworking woman who lives in Pucallpa, a city with a warm and inviting climate. This area is full of beautiful and varied wildlife and is known for having a variety of cuisines. Ana is a woman who has gone through very difficult moments. She has two children and her husband abandoned her when they were still young. Ana was left alone to care for her children. From that moment, she became both mother and father to them. In order to generate an income, Ana exerted a great deal of effort into starting her business of selling beauty products and clothing. She works approximately nine hours a day and is able to serve up to 12 customers each day. Ana believes she is doing well in her business because she is friendly with her customers and, most of all, she offers quality products.

Ana is very grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to the assistance they have provided, she will be able to buy materials, such as nails and wood, as well as pay for labor in order to make improvements to her home. Due to the heavy rains, her home gets flooded. Making these repairs will improve her quality of life. Ana continues to strive toward fulfilling her greatest wish of having a beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and pay for labor.

loans.name: Jose Alcides

texts.es:
José, se dedica a la agricultura. El tiene 45 años de edad, vive en casa propia y tiene tres hijos los cuales tienen edades de 3, 6 y 15 años, trabaja en el cultivo de maíz para obtener ingresos y ayudar con los gastos del hogar a su familia; el oficio lo realiza de lunes a sábado de 6:00 am a 12:00 pm y lo aprendió con sus padres, ya que trabaja en lo mismo y tiene 10 años de hacerlo en lo propio.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar insumos agrícolas tales como: seis sacos de abono, cuatro de sulfato y dos de fórmula para llevar a cabo el cultivo; este le ayudara a mejorar la productividad e incrementar sus utilidades.
Su sueño es mejorar económicamente y financiarles el estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
José works in agriculture.  He’s 45-years-old, lives in his own house and has three children aged 3, 6 and 15 years.  He works growing corn to earn income and help with his family’s household expenses.  He works Monday through Saturday from 6am until noon.  He learned it from his parents since he works in the same thing; he has been working for himself for ten years.

The loan he needs will allow him to buy farm supplies like six sacks of manure, four of sulfate and two of formula to carry out his planting.  This will help him to improve productivity and increase profits.  His dream is to improve economically and to be able to pay for his children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta  vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 11 y 2 años de edad,  Ella posee una venta de todo tipo de  ropa: toallas, pantalones, sabanas, cubrecamas, etc. la venta que comercia es de muy buena calidad y la vende a precios accesibles es por eso que se ha hecho de mucha clientela últimamente; la clienta es muy activa siempre se encuentra trabajando luchando por salir adelante. Para ella el propósito y coraje que le pone a su labor tiene una dirección ver crecer el negocio para lograr un mejor futuro, es por eso que se decidió solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa en variedad como faldas, pantalones, blusas, camisetas, toallas, sabanas,  etc. Así siempre podrá satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Ella  tiene la esperanza que de esta forma lograra darle a su familia seguridad económica y una vida plena.
texts.en:
This member lives in her own home with her husband and their two children, who are ages eleven and two. She sells all sorts of clothing: towels, pants, sheets, bedspreads, etc. The merchandise she sells is very high quality, and she sells it at affordable prices, which is why her customer base has increased lately. She is a very active person. She is always working and fighting for a better life. 

For her, the purpose and courage that she puts into her work are the tools she uses to achieve her goals: she wants to see her business expand and achieve a better future. That is why she decided to request a loan from Integral that will allow her to buy a variety of clothing, like skirts, pants, blouses, shirts, towels, sheets, etc. so that she can always satisfy her customers' needs. She is hopeful that this will allow her to give her family financial security and a full life.

loans.use: to purchase skirts, pants, blouses, shirts, towels, sheets, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase dresses, underpants, stockings, bras, and other items.

loans.name: Basonat

texts.ru: Басонат молодая замужняя женщина. Ей 23 года. Она проживает в городе Вахдат. У нее средне-техническое образование. Басонат умеет вышивать национальные женские платья. Она хочет заняться этой деятельностью и принимать заказы у себя дома. Басонат обратилась за кредитом, чтобы приобрести компьютерную швейную машинку. Она планирует в день вышивать одно простое платье и одно платье с вышивкой. В ее деятельности ей будет помогать мать.
texts.en: Basonat is a young woman.  She is 23 years old.  She lives in the city of Vahdat.  She has a vocational high school education.  Basonat can embroider traditional women's dresses. She would like to set up a business doing this and to take orders in her home.  Basonat applied for a loan to buy a computerized sewing machine.  She plans to make one plain dress and one dress with embroidery per day.  Her mother will help her with her business.

loans.use: to buy a computerized sewing machine

loans.name: Noelia

texts.es:
La señorita Noelia tiene 20 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Itá con sus padres, se dedica a la venta ambulante hace 2 años. Trabaja con su madre quien le ayuda a repartir sus productos, y de esa forma esta creciendo.
Ella cuenta que desea poder ayudar a su familia, por eso que desde joven ha trabajado para sentirse útil y dar un granito de arena a quienes necesitan de ella.
La señorita Noelia solicita el préstamo para la compra de prendas y calzados para aumentar su stock de productos y pueda generar mayores ventas y por ende más ganancias, agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya y a Kiva por la oportunidad recibida y se compromete a utilizar bien su crédito y trabajar duro por salir adelante.
texts.en:
Srta. Noelia is 20 years old and lives in the city of Itá with her parents. She has been in traveling sales for two years. Noelia works with her mother, who helps with delivering products, which has allowed her to grow. She has worked from a young age because it makes her feel useful and it allows her to give a little bit back to those who are in need.

Srta. Noelia is requesting a loan in order to buy clothing and shoes to increase her inventory of products. This will enable her to generate more sales and eventually earn more income. She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the opportunity she has received and commits to putting this loan to good use and working hard to succeed.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 43 years old and married with five children.

Marilyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business direct selling Natasha online catalog products in the Philippines. Marilyn requested a PHP 23000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like pants, shoes, bags, slippers, lipstick, perfume, shirts and other items to sell.

Marilyn has borrowed and repaid 26 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the direct selling business for nine years and also earns an income from pig fattening and farming coconut.

Marilyn aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like pants, shoes, bags, slippers, lipstick, perfume, shirts and other items to sell

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing materials for her business.

Michelle has been in this business for 10 years.

Michelle has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing materials for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase shirts, blouses, pants, and other items of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es: El Sr. Juan tiene 23 años y es casado con un hijito de dos  años,  el se dedica  a la confección de prendas de vestir desde hace ya tres años el confecciona chamarras y ropa  deportiva, tiene su taller se encuentra en su mismo domicilio que es en la en la zona de Chijini,  Este préstamo es su  Primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Juan va a utilizar este préstamo para la  compra de telas para la confección de prendas de vestir por mayor, Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para incremento de capital de inversión,  El Sr. Juan enfrenta retos en su negocio que son aumentar sus ingresos y va a utilizar los beneficios invirtiendo en la compra de materiales para la confección de prendas de buena calidad y así tener más pedidos de clientes. Ya que esta época tiene mucha demanda, el  Sr. Juan es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Juan is 23 years old and married with one small child, who is two years old. He works making clothing. He has been making jackets and athletic clothing for three years now. His workshop is set up in his home, which is located in the area of Chijini.

This is his first cycle within our institution. Juan is going to use this loan to purchase wholesale fabric to make clothing items. The reason he is requesting this loan is to increase his investment capital. The challenge Juan faces in his business is increasing his income, and he will use his profit to invest in purchasing high quality materials to make his clothing in order to obtain more orders from customers. There is a lot of demand during this time of the year. Juan is a very hard worker and he is happy and grateful for the support offered by our institution.

loans.use: to purchase fabric to make athletic clothing.

loans.name: Maria Delmy

texts.es:
María, solicita un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de más capital de trabajo para surtir la tienda; este le permitirá comprar productos de primera necesidad tales como: azúcar, sal, frijoles, aceite, jabón, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a fortalecer el negocio y sus ingresos han incrementado, los invirtió en el financiamiento del estudio de sus hijos; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares se han optimizado.
texts.en:
María’s requesting a new loan because she needs more working capital to stock the store.  This one will make it possible for her to buy basic staples like sugar, salt, beans, oil and soap, among others.

The previous loan helped her strengthen the business and income has increased; she invested it in her children’s schooling.  Her economic conditions and family circumstances have been optimized.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, beans, oil and soap, among others.

loans.name: Pedro Dimas

texts.es:
Pedro, solicita un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de más capital de trabajo para seguir invirtiendo en el cultivo de maíz y frijol; este le permitirá comprar insumos agrícolas tales como: abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, plaguicidas, pesticidas.
El crédito anterior le ayudo  a adquirir todo lo necesario para el cultivo de granos básicos y con las utilidades ha aportado para su familia; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Pedro’s asking for a new loan because he needs more working capital to continue investing in his corn and bean crops.  This one will make it possible for him to buy farm supplies like manure, herbicide, insecticide, fungicide and pesticide.

The previous loan helped him to buy everything needed for basic grains growing and he used all his profits for his family.  His economic conditions and family circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Monaira

texts.en:
Monaira is 50 years old and single. 

Monaira is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Monaira requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and seed for her farming business.

Monaira has been farming root crops and vegetables for four years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Monaira would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed for her farming business

loans.name: Nerrie

texts.en:
Nerrie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell such as soap, spices, canned goods, eggs and noodles for her general store business.

Nerrie has been in this business for five years. Nerrie also earns income from buying and selling fish.

Nerrie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell such as soap, spices, canned goods, eggs and noodles.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 52 years old and married with seven children, one in school, Nida works very hard to provide for them.

Nida runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, oil, spices, noodles, sugar and milk to sell.

Nida has been in this business for eight years.

In the future, Nida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, oil, spices, noodles, sugar and milk to sell in her store.

loans.name: Ferdos

texts.en:
Ferdos is 29 years old, a young and energetic woman. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan along with her husband and one child. Her husband is running a small shop located at the corner of their street. 

Ferdos has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. As the summer season has arrived and to meetl the demand of customers, her husband would like to keep some cold drinks in his shop. He would purchase cold drinks with the loan amount and this would increase his sales and income. 

Ferdos is very much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Ofelia works hard to support her family. She has a 'buy and sell rice grains' business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. Ofelia is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell for her business.

Ofelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream:  to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Daniel Santos

texts.es:
Daniel, solicita un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de más capital de trabajo para seguir invirtiendo en el  negocio; este le permitirá comprar repuestos para bicicletas, repuestos para motocicletas y unas láminas para el techo de la casa.
El crédito anterior le ayudo, ya que logro cultivar pero el resultado no fue positivo porque perdió toda la cosecha y por eso, ya no volverá a realizar cultivos agrícolas; las condiciones económicas se han mantenido, asimismo las circunstancias familiares.
texts.en:
Daniel is requesting another loan because he needs more working capital to continue investing in his business.  This will allow him to buy bicycle parts, motorcycle parts, and some corrugated metal sheets for the roof of his house.

The previous loan helped him because he managed to farm.  The results weren't positive, however, because he lost the entire harvest.  This is why he's not going to plant crops again.

His economic situation and his family circumstances are the same.

loans.use: to buy bicycle and motorcycle parts and some corrugated metal roofing

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es: Don Alfredo de 49 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus 4 hijos, es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarle lo mejor a su familia, es muy trabajador, siempre lo ha realizado con alegría y entusiasmo, se dedica a ser agricultora siembra maíz y maicillo. Alfredo  desea incrementar sus ventas y por solicita un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía que es donde siembra. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Alfredo, 49, lives in his own house with his wife and four children.  He’s a man who is very responsible with his home commitments since he’s always been noted for providing the best for his family.  He’s very hardworking and has always worked with joy and enthusiasm.  

He works growing corn and sorghum.  Alfredo would like to increase sales which is why he’s asking for a loan to buy seeds, manure, fertilizer and pesticide, among others and to improve the land he grows on that appears in the photo.  He’d like to have the requested support because he has no other source of income and this way he will continue to provide daily bread for his home with no limits whatsoever.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Maria Petronila

texts.es: Doña maria de 46 años de edad, es una persona es muy amable y trabajadora, vive con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos, Ella trabaja muy duro en su propia parcela donde siembra maiz y frijol; sus productos son de muy buena calidad cuando su cosecha ya esta lista sale a comercializarla a los diferentes mercados que estan cerca de su lugar de residencia. maria solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL para contar con el dinero necesario e invertir en la compra de insumos agrícolas como controles de plaga y fertilizantes, abonos, semillas entre otras cosas que necesita para su siembra, ella  ansía aumentar sus ventas para poder percibir mayores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica
texts.en:
María, 46, is a very kind, hardworking person living with her husband and four children.  She works very hard on her own parcel of land growing corn and beans.  Her products are very high quality and when she harvests them she heads out to sell them in various markets near her place of residence.

María’s asking Integral for a loan in order to have the necessary money to buy farm supplies like seeds, fertilizer, manure and pest control, among other things she needs for her crops.  She hopes to increase her sales to earn higher profits and give her family better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chickens and concentrated poultry feed.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a mother of one child who is of school-going age. She resides in Nkubu, Meru region of Eastern Kenya. She has been a farmer for 15 years producing and selling cereals. Besides farming she has a retail business as an extra source of income.

She has approached Juhudi Kilimo for a loan of KES.30,000 to help in the construction of a water tank.This will help in proper storage of water for her farming activities.The challenges she faces are crop pests and diseases, and insufficient water. In the next five years, she wants to have a large cereals store.

This loan will improve her family's living standards. Josephine chose Juhudi Kilimo for its faster processing of loans.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling fruit in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy additional fruit to sell for her business.

Rosa has been in this business for 20 years. She earns more income from farming rice, pig fattening and from her general store.

Rosa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fruit to sell

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en: Arlene,  a 31-year-old married woman with four children, comes from Pana-on, Misamis Occidental and is earning 4,000 PHP monthly from her 'sari-sari' store business, selling dry goods in their local community. She's been doing this business for three years to help her husband. In 2012, she joined GDMPC to gain access to microfinance and now, she's requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. She wants to have  better living conditions for her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Solita

texts.en:
Solita is 47 years old, married, and has six children. She works hard to provide for her family. Solita runs a business selling dry goods in the Philippines and has requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more inventory of dry goods to sell.

Solita has borrowed and paid 31 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her business for 25 years and also earns an income from raising pigs. Solita aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy dry goods to sell

loans.name: Hilario De Jesus

texts.es: Hilario de 38 años de edad, es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar. Actualmente vive junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos,  se dedica a ser agricultor siembra maíz, maicillo y frijol. Hilario desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso ha solicitado un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, entre otras cosas, para seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar.
texts.en: Hilario, 38, is a man who is very responsible with his commitments at home.  He currently lives with his wife and three children.  He works growing corn, sorghum and beans.  Hilario wants to increase sales which is why he’s asked for a loan that will make it possible for him to buy seeds and manure, among other things to continue bringing daily bread home.

loans.use: to buy seed, manure, fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: José es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarle lo mejor a su familia. Actualmente vive junto a su esposa y su hijo es muy trabajador, siempre lo ha realizado con alegría y entusiasmo, se dedica a ser agricultora siembra maíz y frijol cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografia para luego salir a comercializarlos a las agencias de compra-venta de granos basicos. José desea incrementar sus ventas por eso solicita un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
José’s a man who takes his home commitments seriously since he’s always been noted for providing the best for his family.  He currently lives with his wife and son.  He’s very hardworking and always works with joy and enthusiasm.  He works growing corn and beans and when the harvest is ready he stores it in silos like shown in the photograph to then go out to sell it to agencies that buy and sell basic grains.

José would like to increase his sales which is why he’s requested a loan to buy seed, manure, fertilizer and pesticide, among others.  He’d like to get the requested help because he has no other source of income and this way he will be able to continue providing daily bread for his home with no limits whatsoever.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Mil Flores Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por cuatro socios emprendedores una de ellas es Claudia mujer de 50 años, casada, con un hijo su negocio es la venta de fritangas y almuerzos en el mercado de Masaya, actividad que viene realizando desde hace 12 años, 4 años de estar trabajando la institución  como clientes, este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como 30lbs de carne de pollo, 20 lbs de carne de res, 20 lbs de frijoles crudos, 15º plátanos verdes, 150 plátanos maduros, 3galones de aceite, 1 galón de salsa de tomate, 1 galón de vinagre, 5 unidades de repollo, 1 galón de mostaza, 5lbs de cebolla,etc. Merali, tiene 34 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de fritanga en su domicilio, Erick tiene 31 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de productos lácteos y brinda servicio de moto taxis, Claudia tiene 45 años su negocio es la venta de muebles y cerámicas.
texts.en:
This group consists of four enterprising members. One of them is Claudia, a 50-year-old woman who is married and has one child. Her business involves selling fried foods and breakfasts at a market in Masaya. She has been in business for 12 years and has worked with ADIM as a client for four of those years. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of supplies such as 30 pounds of chicken, 20 pounds of beef, 20 pounds of raw beans, 150 green plantains, 150 ripe plantains, 3 gallons of oil, 1 gallon of tomato sauce, 1 gallon of vinegar, 5 units of cabbages, 1 gallon of mustard, 5 pounds of onions, and other items.

The other members are as follows: • Merali is 34 years old and has a business of selling fried foods from her home. • Erick is 31 years old and has a business of selling dairy products. He also provides motorcycle taxi services. • Claudia is 45 years old and has a business of selling furniture and ceramics.

loans.use: to buy chicken, beef, raw beans, green plantains, ripe plantains, oil, tomato sauce, vinegar, cabbages, mustard, onions, and other supplies.

loans.name: Dúo Sol Y Sombra Group

texts.es: Dúo Sol y Sombra, este grupo esta conformado por la señora Maria Romilia de 59 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles de consumo diario tiene 9 años de tener su tienda y es asi como ella apoya a la economia de su hogar esta solicitando su credito para la compra de productos comestibles de consumo diario espera que le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en:
The group is called "Sun and Shadow Duo." Maria Romilia, who is 59 years of age, and dedicated to selling food products that are consumed daily, is a member. She has operated her store for 9 years and, thus, she contributes income to her household economy. 

Maria is requesting a loan to purchase more food products that are consumed daily. She hopes that you can help her with the solicited loan.

loans.use: to buy food products that are consumed daily to sell.

loans.name: Reseda Y Sontol Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias emprendoras con éxitos una de ellas es Aydalina mujer de 37 años de edad, acompañada,  con dos hijos, originaria de Masaya tiene 15 años de dedicarse en la producción y venta de hojuelas, espumias, ambulante en la capital, tiene 10 meses de ser cliente de  la institución, este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como harina, azúcar, leñas, bolsa de gabacha, bolsa de libra, canela, huevos, colorantes etc.Lizett  tiene 26 años su negocio es la venta de chinelas y Rosa tiene 69 años de edad su negocio es la venta de tortillas.
texts.en:
This group comprises three entreprising and successful members. One of them is Aydalina, who is a 37-year-old woman who lives with her partner and has two children. She is originally from Masaya. She has been making and selling fried pastries and meringue cookies for fifteen years as a street vendor in the capital. She has been a client of our institution for ten months. She will invest this loan in purchasing ingredients and supplies like flour, sugar, firewood, plastic bags of different sizes, cinnamon, eggs, food coloring, etc.

Lizett is 26 years old and her business is selling sandals, while Rosa is 69 years old and her business is selling tortillas.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and supplies, like flour, sugar, firewood, plastic bags of different sizes, cinnamon, eggs, food coloring, etc.

loans.name: Adolat

texts.ru: Адолат добрая женщина и имеет высшее образование. Ей 56 лет. Она вдова и имеет 2 сыновей. Сыновьям 27 и 36 лет. Адолат очень заботливая мать для своих сыновей. Она всегда старалась, чтобы ее дети были счастливы. Адолат более 15 лет работает в средней школе учительницей информатики. Еще она выполняет должность заместителя директора по хозяйственным делам. Адолат любит свою профессию и честно выполняет все свои должности. Она имеет хорошую репутацию среди коллег, и она считает, что «учитель-главное звено общества».  Адолат тратит свою зарплату для обеспечения семьи. Уже несколько лет она планирует отремонтировать свою квартиру, но не имеет денег. Она должна отремонтировать все комнаты и покрыть крышу шифером, так как во время дождевого сезона, дождь течет с потолка. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 10000 сомони для ремонта квартиры. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Adolat is a kind 56-year-old woman, who possesses a university degree. She is a widow and caring mother of two sons, who are 27 and 36 years old. Adolat has always tried to ensure her children's happiness. 

Adolat has worked as an informatics teacher in a high school for more than 15 years. She is also the vice-director of agricultural matters. Adolat loves her profession and believes that teachers are the bond that holds society together. She spends her salary to take care of her family. 

Adolat has been planning to renovate her apartment for a few years now, but she doesn't have the money. She needs to renovate all the rooms and cover the roof with slate because it leaks during the rainy season. She is requesting a 10000 som loan to renovate her apartment. She is waiting on your kindness!

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for repairing her apartment

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad is a Lebanese single man. He is 30 years old. He is living with his parents and two working siblings. His father seeks to manage the family’s life and cover their expenses. This is the reason why Imad started to work really hard to take some responsibilities off his father.

 Five years ago, Imad started his independent business. He opened a coffee shop in his town. He has his own loyal customers who always meet at his place to have fun and enjoy their free time. With his requested youth loan from Kiva Partner Vitas s.a.l he will be able to renovate his coffee shop. This will increase the number of his customers and most probably his revenue. One of his greatest dreams is to save money and have his own family and children.

loans.use: to renovate his coffee shop

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 43 years old and married, with four children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Teresita is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy rice seeds, fertilizers and other farm equipment.

Teresita has been farming rice for 20 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal and rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizer and other farm equipment

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Violeta works hard to support her family.

She has a fruit vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.  Violeta is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional fruits like jackfruit, grapes, bananas, and other fruits to sell for her fruit vending business.

Violeta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fruits like jackfruit, grapes, bananas, and other fruits to sell

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco es de la comarca Escobillo Teustepe casado, tiene 6 hijos los cuales ya están casados. Él se dedica a cultivar maíz y frijol y cuenta que aunque el papa en aquel tiempo que él era joven tenía dinero el no pudo aprender a leer ya que el papa solo vivía tomando licor y al morir el papa quedo en la ruina, su hermano mayor le enseño a trabajar la tierra sembrando maíz y frijol , a la edad de 25 años se casó y la mama le heredo partes de las tierras y ganado que hasta hoy conserva , sus labores de siembra las con ayuda de mozos a los que les paga  por día trabajado y cuando saca la cosecha la lleva a vender al mercado de Managua ya que alla le pagan muy bien el grano además don francisco vende sus cuajaditas de la leche que le proporcionan sus vacas.  Hoy don francisco está solicitando este crédito para comprar fertilizantes, el abono y pago de mano de obra para hacer la huerta de maíz y frijol .Don francisco dice que el crédito le ayudara a realizar todos los trabajos de la siembra de maíz y frijol , él dice que una vez que cancele el crédito con los ingresos de la cosecha el dinero que le sobre piensa invertirlo en mejoras de la finca.
texts.en:
Francisco’s from the Escobillo District in Teustepe.  He’s married and has six children who are all married now.  

He works growing corn and beans and he relates that even though his father back then had money, he wasn’t able to learn to read because his father was an alcoholic and when his father died they were left bankrupt.  His older brother taught him to work the land and to grow corn and beans.  

He got married at the age of 25 and his mother passed down land and cattle to him that he still has today.  He does his farming chores with help from laborers he hires and pays a daily wage to.  When his harvests are in he takes them to be sold in the market in Managua because he’s paid well for the grains there.  Francisco also sells the cheese made from milk his cattle produces.

Today, Francisco is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and manure and to pay labor costs for his corn and bean crops.  Francisco says that the loan will help him do all the work required to plant corn and beans.  He says that once he repays the loan with income from the harvest he will use any left over money to make improvements to the farm.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Amparo Justina

texts.es: Doña Amparo, una señora que ha procreado 8 hijos, lo cual no ha sido nada fácil darles la alimentación, educación y muchas otras  cosas primordiales en la vida, pero como es trabajadora y con la ayuda de su esposo ha logrado salir adelante, hoy en día casi todos son independientes a excepción de dos que todavía son adolecentes y están a su cargo, su medio de ganarse la vida continua siendo una pequeña pulpería, ella busca como mejorar las condiciones de su hogar por lo que solicita este 4to crédito para reparar techo y continuar la construcción de un cuarto que ya había empezado y espera con este financiamiento poder avanzar lo más que pueda ya que le hacen falta paredes ventanas entre otros.
texts.en:
Amparo is a woman who has had eight children.  Giving them food, an education, and a lots of other life essentials has not been easy at all.  However, as a hard-worker, and with help from her husband, she has managed to get ahead.  Now almost all of them are independent.  Only two are still adolescents and under her care.  Her way of earning a living continues to be a small grocery store.

She is looking for a way to improve her homes conditions.  That is why she is requesting her fourth loan to repair the roof and continue building a room she has already started.  With this loan she hopes to be able to advance as much as she can.  The room needs walls and windows, among other things.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Socorro Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por cuatros socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Rosaura, mujer de 37 años, casada, y con dos hijos menores, desde hace 8 años su negocio es la venta de ropa, zapatos nuevos, tiene un año de ser cliente de la institución, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de ropa como pantalón de varón, pantalón de mujer, blusas, faldas, talladoras, camisas para hombre, sandalias, zapatos de damas etc. Janeth es una mujer de 31 años su negocio es la venta de artículos plásticos y Catalina tiene 47 años de edad y su negocio es la compra y venta de cosechas como naranjas dulces, tamarindo etc. y Myriam tiene 47 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de hojas de chagüites para hacer nacatamales al por mayor.
texts.en:
This group is composed of four enterprising members.  One of them is Rosaura, 37, who is married and has two minor children.  Her business for the last 8 years has been selling new clothes and shoes.  She’s been a client of the institution for a year.  She will use the loan to buy clothes like men’s pants, women’s pants, blouses, skirts, corsets, men’s shirts, sandals, women’s shoes, etc.

Janeth, 31, sells plastic ware and Catalina, 47, buys and sells fruit harvests like orange and tamarind and Myriam, 47, sells banana leaves at wholesale to make Nacatamales [Nicaraguan style tamales].

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es:
Humberto, solicita un nuevo préstamo para mantenerse activo trabajando y así obtener ingresos para los gastos familiares; este le permitirá comprar insumos agrícolas tales como: herbicidas, insecticidas, plaguicidas, pesticidas y semilla de maíz.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a mejorar las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares se han optimizado.
texts.en:
Humberto is requesting a new loan so that he can remain active in his work and generate income for family expenses. This loan will enable him to buy farming supplies such as herbicides, insecticides, fungicides, pesticides, and corn seeds.

His previous loan helped to improve his financial condition. His family circumstances have also become optimal.

loans.use: to buy herbicides, insecticides, fungicides, pesticides, and corn seeds.

loans.name: Juan Irene

texts.es: Juan, es una humilde habitante de Boaco, viudo, padre de 4 hijos , se dedica a la venta de leche y costura . Su primer negocio fue la costura tomo un curso de 5 meses después fue aprendiz de un sastre que le enseño desde planchar hasta coser cada centímetro de tela, le fue gustando él tenía 25 años cuando aprendió este oficio adicional vende leche en su humilde carretilla y sus recipientes de plásticos llenos de leche y listo para abastecer a su clientela, es así como se gana la vida a diario buscando cada día conseguir una mejor calidad de vida. Hoy está requiriendo el financiamiento para comprar tela y leche. Esto le permitirá cumplir con los pedidos que tiene pendiente y abastecer como cada mañana a sus clientes con leche fresca. Uno de sus proyectos próximos es mejorar su vivienda componer el techo antes que entre el invierno.
texts.en:
Juan is a humble resident of Boaco. He is a widower and a father of four children. He works selling milk and sewing. His first business was sewing. He took a five month course and later apprenticed under a tailor, who taught him everything from ironing to sewing every inch of fabric. He took a liking to this trade, which he learned when he was 25 years old. Additionally, he sells milk from his humble cart in plastic containers filled with milk and ready to supply his customers. That is how he earns his daily living, finding his way day by day to achieve a better quality of life. 

Today he is requesting financing in order to purchase fabric and milk. This will allow him to fulfill his pending orders and supply his customers with fresh milk every morning. One of his next projects is improving his home by repairing the roof before the winter comes.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and milk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, insecticides, and pesticides.

loans.name: Jehova Es Mi  Luz Group

texts.es: Tres socios emprendedores forman este grupo una de ellas es Angélica mujer de 22 años de edad, casada, con un hijo, tiene 9 años de tener una pulpería en su domicilio , de ser cliente de la  institución tiene 8 meses, ella misma atiende su negocio el crédito lo  invertirá en la compra de granos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, queso, productos lácteos, papel higiénicos, jugo de latas, jugo en cajas, sal, carne de res, carne de pollos, vegetales, bisuterías, pampers, productos lácteos, leñas, medicamentos populares, huevo, sopas maggi, etc. Miguel tiene 39 años de edad su negocio es la venta de verduras y perecederos y Milagro tiene 38 años de  edad y su negocio es la venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Three enterprising members form this group.  Angélica, age 22, is one of them.  She is married and has one child.  She has had a grocery store in her home for nine years.  She has been a client of the institution for eight months.  She tends to her business herself.

She will use the loan to buy basic goods like rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, cheese, dairy products, toilet paper, canned juice, juice boxes, salt, beef, chicken, vegetables, costume jewelry, Pampers, firewood, popular over the counter medications, eggs, and Maggi brand soups, etc.

Miguel, age 39, has a business selling vegetables and perishables.  Milagro, age 38, has a business selling clothes.

loans.use: to buy basic goods to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Meteda

texts.en:
Mr. Meteda is a committed salesman who lives on the northern shore of Papua. Papua is one of the most remote islands of Indonesia and is the scene of a long lasting armed unrest.

Safe drinking water is hard to get in Papua, therefore Meteda is proudly selling Nazava water filters that turn well and rain water into water that is safe to drink. By selling Nazava Water Filters, Meteda earns an additional 100 dollars per month while at the same time providing clean drinking water to many of his community members. 

Most trade in Papua is done by migrants from other parts of Indonesia. Meteda, who is a native Papuan, sees it as his duty to show his fellow Papuans that they can also become successful businessmen.  Meteda can be found in local markets around his hometown, Sentani, promoting Nazava Water Filters.

Meteda wants to expand to more local markets, plus begin doing demonstrations at local offices. Meteda will use this loan to buy more Nazava water filters on credit. Because Meteda lives more than 3000 kilometres away from the Nazava warehouse it is very important to have enough stock.

loans.use: To grow his water filter business and be a role model for other local entrepreneurs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand water filter sales and increase the access to safe and affordable drinking water in Kupang, East Indonesia Province

loans.name: Chikim B Group

texts.en:
Chikim B Group consists of ten hard-working women. They live in a village which is about 40 km away from the town capital of Manipur which is in the North-Eastern state of India. The extreme left in the picture is Ngailam and she is featured with hand raised. She represents the featured borrower for the Chikim B Group and she runs a toy shop in the town market. She lives with her ailing husband and four kids. Her husband is suffering from a prolapsed disc thus he cannot move freely.

Ngailam sell toys in the town market shed and she makes a very good profit. Her sales includes toys for girls and boys whose age ranges from 3-13 yrs. She sells dolls, kitchen wares, dressing kits, doctors kits etc. for girls and plastic guns, pistols, water pistols, paint guns and GI Joes for boys. She makes a good income because there are very few vendors for toy shops. Kids like to purchase new toys and play with them thus it is essential for her to refill her shop with more interesting toys to attract kids. Her sales increase during the summer and winter breaks because kids are on vacation. Therefore, she keeps track of the school breaks and makes sure she has what the kids want in her toy shop.

With the Kiva Loan she will purchase more variations of toys for both boys and girls. She is planning to purchase and sell Barbie dolls, stuffed toys, war tanks, remote access toys and super heroes masks. She always wanted to keep these toys in her shop but her income was small. She also takes care of her ailing husband who needs a monthly routine check-up in which she spends a lot on medication. She is glad that Kiva will assist her financially in bringing growth to her business and allowing her to sell better and attractive toys.

Her plan is to save money and give surgery in a well-reputed private hospital in the state capital. She thanks WSDS and Kiva for the love and support towards herself and the Chikim B Group. The rest of the group members are also engaged in poultry, weaving, piggery, and grocery.

loans.use: To purchase more variety of plastic toys and expand the shop.

loans.name: Mimi Lom Group

texts.en:
Zamdeihching's husband usually teases her by saying, "You love weaving more than your husband" and she laughs it off. Her love for weaving is undeniable and proven. Her supportive husband is the main reason for her to do well in her business. He understands and initiates her weaving activity. She is the featured borrower for the "Mimi Lom" Group and she is pictured on the extreme left corner with raised hand. Their group is comprised of five women who live in a town which is about 60 km from the main capital town of Manipur, which is in the north-eastern side of India.

Zamdeihching is a very talented and fast learner when it comes to weaving. She used to be a paid weaver before she was married. After she was married, her husband bought a loom for her and she started weaving for her own income. Gradually, she started making a good progress and started supplying her woven products to the shops in town. Her hard work pays off with the trust she earns from her clients/customers. In order to meet the demand she bought two more looms on credit and also started hiring paid weavers. With the profits she could successfully pay back her loan for the loom and also pay the hired weavers. 

She says the demands are rising each day and she couldn't meet the demands of her clients with three looms and four weavers only. Therefore, with the Kiva loan, she will purchase one more loom. She is glad that she will be able to utilise her profits in buying different yarns and weaving materials while the Kiva loan will be used for purchasing a loom. She aspires to own a shop in the town market where she can sell her products. She says "Thank you so much for the support Kiva" and wishes a good luck.

loans.use: To purchase another loom and increase her woven products for more profits.

loans.name: Dinas Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias emprendedoras con éxito una de ellas es Dina mujer de 35 años, soltera con dos hijas su negocio es la venta de zapatos y ropa nueva, tiene 4 años de estar en ese negocio, anteriormente era ama de casa, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de zapatos varonil, zapatos cerrados, zapatos bajos de dama, zapatos pumas, chores bandex, camisetas de cuello de varón, pantalón Texas de varón, blusas, camisolas etc. Esther tiene 30 años de edad y su negocio es un taller de zapatería y Patricia mujer de 28 años su negocio es la venta de zapatos.
texts.en:
This group is composed of 3 entrepreneurs who have been successful. One of them is Dina, a 35-year-old woman, who is single with 2 daughters. Her business is selling shoes and new clothes. The business has existed for 4 years. Previously, she was a housewife. 

The loan Dina is requesting will be used for buying mens shoes, closed-toed shoes, low-heeled womens shoes, Pumas, Bandex clothes, T-shirts with mens collars, Texas-style pants, blouses, camisoles, etc.

Esther is 30 years old and has a shoe-making shop.  Patricia is a 28-year-old woman whose business also sells shoes.

loans.use: to buy men's shoes, closed-toed shoes, women's low-heeled shoes, Pumas, Bandex clothes, T-shirts with mens collars,Texas-style mens pants, blouses, camisoles, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Jairo Antonio

texts.es:
Jairo,35 años de edad , es un humilde comerciante habitante de Boaco, casado, padre de tres hijos,  él  es dueño de una pequeña pulpería negocio que inicio desde hace 4 años empezó vendiendo dulces, pan ,azúcar y frijoles. Hoy en día vende jabones, papel higiénico, enlatados, gaseosas y jugos con el paso del tiempo poco a poco ha ido surtiendo su negocio. Él tiene pensado poner un pequeño kiosco de snacks y jugos a orilla de la carretera por eso sigue ahorrando por lo pronto quiere comprar un freezer para vender pollo y carnes productos que aún no vende, es por esto que parte  de las ganancias las está ahorrando para ese proyecto.
Él está requiriendo  el crédito para comprar azúcar, aceite, avenas, galleta, pan, jugos, gaseosas, enlatados, detergentes, jabón, papel higiénico.
texts.en:
Jairo, age 35, is a humble merchant living in Boaco.  He is married and has three children.  He has a small grocery store business, which he started four years ago.  He started selling candy, bread, sugar and beans.  He now sells soaps, toilet paper, canned goods, soft drinks, and juices.  With the passage of time, little by little, he has been stocking his business.

He is planning on setting up a small snack and juice kiosk on the edge of the road.  Therefore, he will continue saving.  For the time being he wants to buy a freezer in order to sell chicken and meat products that he does not yet sell.  This project is what part of his savings is for.

He needs a loan to buy sugar, cooking oil, oatmeal, cookies, bread, juices, soft drinks, canned goods, detergents, soap, and toilet paper.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cooking oil, oatmeal, cookies, bread, juices, soft drinks, canned goods, detergents, soap, and toilet paper.

loans.name: San Juan 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado (San Juan 2) está en su tercer ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde algunas señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir, con ingresos muy bajos. La encuesta les ayuda a conocer la situación de cada una de ellas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Eulalia, quien en su primera encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos, es decir con un ingreso medio, pero aun poco, ella trabaja en la venta de bebidas y comestibles, y  través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo, capacitación e incentivo que le da la fundación ella se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza. Este Comité  esta con ganas de trabajar con la fundación es su tercer crédito a través de comité. Están conscientes que tienen que trabajar más y aplicar las capacitaciones que se le brinda constantemente 
La Sra. Eulalia Solicita de este crédito para la compra de carne, para vender,  lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
This group's name is San Juan 2. It is in its third cycle within the Women's Committee Program, where they all work and help each other in order to get ahead. They are completing the poverty elimination survey, and some of the women are living below the poverty line, that is, with very low income. The survey helps them understand each of their situations. 

One of this group's members is Eulalia, who according to her first survey was at poverty level #2, that is, medium income but still low. She works selling drinks and food items, and she is improving her situation thanks to her own effort and persevering work, as well as through trainings and incentives offered by our foundation. This Committee is eager to keep working with our foundation and this is their third loan through the Committee. They are aware that thay have to work harder and consistently apply the trainings they attend.

Eulalia is requesting this loan to purchase meat to sell. It will help her define her business plan, which will in turn help her improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase meat to sell.

loans.name: Hara Gouri Group

texts.en:
In 2010, six poor women from a slum area of Bhawanipatna Municipality located in Kalahandi district, one of the poorest regions in India, stepped out and decided to build a secure future for their family by sharing the burden of the family with their husbands. 

All members hail from the Schedule caste and belong to the below poverty line category. The traditional work of this community is cobbler (making, repairing and polishing of different leather products). Normally this work is done by the male members. They formed a joint liability group named Hara Gouri. One of them is Surekha. The lady sitting second from the right with raised hand in the photo is Surekha. Surekha is 33 years old; living with her husband and three sons aged 16, 14 and 11. All three of the children are attending normal school. 

Surekha herself has been selling vegetables like tomatoes, potatoes, onions, brinjal, ladies finger etc., and seasonal fruits like mangos in the daily market of the town for the last 15 years. She brings stock from the local wholesalers. There was always some left-over stock that was not sold which had to be thrown away as they did not have a storage space of their own. So, Surekha decided to start selling these vegetables on her own by the roadside in the market. She now wants to rent a shop that will help her to have a place to sell the vegetables. It will also help her to buy more stock for starting a wholesale business. Buying more stock will help reduce her frequent travel to the market and eventually transportation and buying costs. A portion of the loan amount will help her to rent a shop in the market and purchase more stock of vegetables and fruits. Surekha hopes to complete the construction of her half-built house as soon as possible.

The other five members of her group are Chanchala, Sabita, Kumudini, Gouri and Premsila doing same business of vegetable vending.

loans.use: To buy vegetable items like potato, tomato, brinjal etc.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
